jURsdln9hCEauhMnWPoOBA.review_text: Scoma's has been around before I was born and I've dined at the restaurant several times over the past years.  Recently, I had dinner at the restaurant which offered:  +  Friendly and Attentive Service +  A Wide & Varied Menu +  Fresh, Well Prepared Local Seafood +  Wonderful Fisherman's Wharf Water Views +  Old School Atmosphere - Restaurant has been around since 1965 +  A good assortment of bread  Besides a variety of appetizers, I had the "Lazy Man's" Cioppino as my main dinner entree.  It was a hearty tomato-based fisherman's stew with an assortment of seafood.  I usually like a spicier tomato base but my stew was still perfectly prepared and tasty.  I will continue to dine at Scoma's and I'm still a fan..... 4 Stars!

TVgDN-CZ0wdszYCFXDtOug.review_text: I have been to Scoma's on three different occasions - twice for dinner, once for lunch.  Each time, I have enjoyed my meal and the service has been excellent - from the hostess, to the bartenders, to the wait staff.  The couple of times I have been for dinner, there was a wait so I would suggest making a reservation.  Ask for a table overlooking the bay.  It is a bit pricey but given that it is located on the Wharf, I guess it is to be expected.  What you will get in return is a quality meal served by experienced and attentive wait staff.

_VmNgHSyAjCtDGWaX1YKZQ.review_text: Stopped in yesterday for a glass of wine and a crab cocktail.  We sat at the bar and watched in amazement how well Francis handled the extremely busy  bar.  He was calm and handled the orders as they were coming in never showing anxiety.  I asked him if it was a normal day and he said "no, it was the second busiest day he saw".  He was working the bar by himself and handled it very professional.  He even took a minute just to  talk, never breaking his stride.  My hat is off to him.    The Dungeness crab cocktail was huge.  Scoma's is my go place for great seafood when I am in San Francisco.

LxNow0bElh_DjYTvt0dJuw.review_text: Scoma's, oh Scoma's. What can I say? There are just no words. Visited this lovely little restaurant during a weekend trip to San Francisco after hearing rave reviews from friends and it did not disappoint!   Had the roasted dungeness crab with olive oil, garlic, and butter, and every bite made me want to cry... tears of joy. It was that good! We also had the clam chowder (excellent!) and the crab risotto, which was different, but in a good way.  Our server was pretty great too! He was always on top of things, he was hilarious, and as he really knew his stuff with regards to the food, the specials, and what was worth ordering. A little bit on the pricey side, but for the quality of the seafood.. SO SO WORTH IT!

FVkLfQhvng1NNRW4V6YHGA.review_text: Very busy but accommodating at the same time. Great seafood & thoroughly enjoyed my dinner.  Cocktails left a bit to be desired.  Tried 3 different ones but none were up to snuff. Caesar salad was very light with a fantastic dressing which is not the ordinary for a caesar salad.

gTrG8OHHp0ZvT-xr80o50A.review_text: This is my fourth time here and on previous visits I couldn't stop raving on how good my meal was.  This time I wish we had gone some place else.    I had the Oysters Rockefeller and the Halibut Siciliana. The Oysters were boring and tasted more like cream spinach than oysters.  The Halibut was cooked perfectly but everything else on the plate was a miss; polenta was grainy and undercooked and the vegetables were bland.

-2TJaAdxSGnTyy9qGr1z1Q.review_text: Scoma's was recommended to me by a friend, the concierge at the hotel immediately took me for an expert when I mentioned I was planning to have dinner there. The restaurant is cozy and can be a bit cramped when full, thankfully I had an early dinner so I was comfortable.  The waiter was friendly and efficient, my water glass (and wine glass) stayed full. The lobster bisque was heaven and the pasta pomodoro with scallops was delightful. I intended to take a picture of the raspberry cheesecake but consumed it too quickly.  I heard the waiter mention that the steaks are overcooked but the seafood is always perfect - which is fine because it doesn't make sense to order a steak at a place that offers such great seafood!

IIb5zgMxjxbpy0wrO-GUfw.review_text: One of the greatest seafood places in San Fran. The location is so SF perfect, and the food is so amazing. The chowder, from what I remember, was heavenly. I can't wait to get back over there.

NzJjpVsO0_x3M96E-EM1Yw.review_text: Very very good food, lobster was perfect.   Friendly and energetic staff.  Just an all out amazing restaurant.  A+

UKIbX4yRlGL_92zREMWnwg.review_text: This is your classic old school seafood restaurant. Expect to be thrilled with raw oysters, clam chowder, a large leaf Caesar salad and a dirty martini. Nothing fancy but a wait and two bars to place a cocktail order. It's a great location and view. Know what you are in for and you will be pleased with the result! We walked here from the Kimpton after a long day. Enjoyable but they are certainly not reinventing the wheel!

HUS74wDi6wf7St1NNr2zuw.review_text: Came to San Fran for the first time and wasn't leaving without a real seafood experience. With Scoma's the task was achieved! We ordered 2 of the dungeness crab roasted in garlic butter. OMG it was SO good! It melted in your mouth and cooked to perfection! I ordered a cup of lobster bisque and it was awesome too. We both left feeling satisfied and having a great seafood experience. Our waiter was so friendly and helpful with the menu. The atmosphere is cozy and quaint. We would definitely go back!

an-ijVpGQxgiOBX9qTBOyQ.review_text: Disclaimer -- the food is FIVE stars!  If I were just reviewing food, I would give this place five stars, hands down.    Came to Scoma's on a Valentine's weekend trip to San Francisco.  Arrived on time for our reservation and were seated right away.  I ordered a French martini, which was perfectly made.  I ordered the lobster bisque to start, while my friend ordered the clam chowder.  Hands down, the lobster bisque is the best I've ever had!  It was absolutely delicious!  The clam chowder was also very good, but I'm more of a lobster bisque kind of girl.  For my entrée, I ordered the Mixed Seafood Grill, which included (already de-shelled) scallops, shrimp and 2 lobster tails, along with steamed vegetables and penne pasta.  All of the seafood was fresh and nicely cooked, and the vegetables had that perfect "crunch" to them, meaning they weren't overcooked.  My friend ordered a whole garlic roasted Dungeness crab.  We both absolutely loved our meals!    The only problem we encountered was with the service.  Although our server was very nice, after we ordered our food, we never saw her again until we finished our meals.  She never stopped by to check how we were enjoying our food or to see if there were any issues.  She asked my friend when we ordered our food if he wanted another drink, but after that, she never asked either one of us again.  My martini glass sat empty for a good while during our meal.  And while I would normally just shrug it off and say she's probably overworked, I can't do that because she was continuously checking on the table next to us.  Now I hate to go here, but we're black, and the couple next to us was an older white couple.  I never want to assume that we receive certain treatment (or lack thereof) because of the color of our skin, but how can I assume anything different?  We were very nice to the server and we were spending a lot of money.  And for the record, we spent more money than the couple next to us (I snuck a peak at their check after they left).  Their total check was $90.  Our entrees only were $90, and we both had soup and drinks on top of that.  At those kinds of prices, it's just unacceptable that our server never checked on us or asked us if we wanted more drinks.  We didn't see her again until after we finished our meals and she came by to ask if we wanted dessert.  By that point, we were so turned off that I wouldn't dare order anything more.  And then it took her another 10 minutes to just bring us our check.    I'm hoping this was just a fluke, but for my one visit to Scoma's, and the amount of money we spent, it was very disappointing to me.

U4IzAxlh05CMCAumDJYNwg.review_text: Good food. Large portions. Upscale restaurant. A San Francisco tradition.

roS0oVk3n40u2j2MMO5smA.review_text: I was stuffed after having the mixed seafood plate. It was good and a great view overlooking the water.

mXmr_KuitmDiAmNzleQsog.review_text: Came here for dinner last night and did the "Dine About Town" menu. I ordered the following: Appetizer: Clam Chowder with Caesar Salad : Let me just say that I have NEVER been a fan of Clam Chowder (not even Boudins) but was told that this place had the best..so I gave it a try. I can honestly say that the Clam Chowder was the best part of my meal. It was creamy and did not have that "fishy" taste I dislike. I will probably go back and just have a bowl of this! LOL Main Course: Halibut with sicilian white beans and mashed potatoes. The Halibut was perfectly cooked but needed a little more salt, the mashed potatoes were delicious, and the sicilian white beans were a bit overcooked. Overall, a B Plate. Dessert: The chocolate brownie with espresso ice cream, whipped cream, and caramel. All 4 of my favorite combined in one dish - cant go wrong with this!  Great place to go if you are visiting the city. The restaurant offers free valet parking and the crowd is a bit older - more sr citizens for sure, LOL. Also, the place has some great views of the Bay!  I heard it gets crowded on the weekends so be ready to wait.

5_PJKvfCR4DgX8CUmA5A2Q.review_text: We have been coming to Scoma's for almost 20 years & have always enjoyed it immensely.  This time we were a little  disappointed.    We brought our friends here & talked it up like crazy.  We couldn't wait to dig in to our Shellfish Saute Sec.  The waiter put the food down in front of us & that's when the disappointment set in.  The dish used to be huge & full of tons of seafood.  Lots of crab, big shrimp, & plenty of lobster.  Now there's what seems to be half the amount, a lot less mushrooms, & tons of onions.  It used to come with rice, pasta, & steamed vegetables.  Now it comes with this terrible wild rice & grilled root vegetables.  The vegetables were gross, but the seafood part of the dish was still good.     The rest of the meal was good, Lobster Bisque, Caesar Salad & Fried Calamari.  The waiter was very nice, but smelled like cigarettes.    I'm still giving 3 stars because the food was decent.  The last time we came, it was a 5.  Why did they have to change something that was so prefect?  I don't think we'll be back because the food is no longer worth the money.

e-PD38SNj5g49HProyLRpg.review_text: We were so excited to eat here. Everything was great until dessert. Ordered Two desserts to go. We were  charged for both. Got back to hotel but only one was in the take out bag. Boo.

RTvF1w79w9rl7PG8MNJVzg.review_text: Really really awesome!  I had the lobster ravioli and it was amazing.  Totally worth the price! Plate size is really good too, lots of food!

NZyZ31ozaKXkicPUychQpA.review_text: It ages me immeasurably to say I've been coming here for 10 years, but so be it...I have.  There's nothing particularly fancy about Scoma's, but the food is just darn good.  I keep expecting that one of these times I am going to have a bad experience - because for where it is, you'd think it would be touristy and that the quality would suffer, but for me, it never has.  From the lazy man's cioppino - which is heaven - to the daily specials (last night was a tomato mozzarella salad to die for and a halibut siciliana) to the reasonably priced wine list (relatively speaking, of course...) it's never steered me wrong, or the numerous people I've brought here.  Among the trendy, good adventurous food in San Francisco - which I love - Scoma's stands as an old favorite, sturdy, dependable, and delicious.  I definitely recommend it.

_pIG1_s6Bzymn1zeyLjBHQ.review_text: After spending nearly 3 weeks in South America - I returned wanting to eat anything EXCEPT meat.  Seriously, I kid you not, I had steak every single night while in Argentina that I vowed off steaks for the rest of 2008.  (It's now 2 weeks since I've been back - I still don't want steak!)  So on an evening when we had to pick a place to eat, we decided to hit up this restaurant because their pasta was supposed to be good - and it's a seafood place.  Anything non-meat is good by me.  Located at Fisherman's Wharf, it runs the risk of being "for tourists", and it is.  But once in awhile, that doesn't necessarily mean it's bad, and Scoma was just such an exception.  Their food was good, starting off with the bread and butter.  The wine selection was nice, and we had a wonderful bottle of Riesling.  The clam pasta I had (Pasta Scoma) was quite a generous portion and tasty.  Considering what a fanatic I am about Pasta w/ Clam Sauce, it's hard to impress me but Scoma's dish was not just flavorful but had a WHOPPING amount of fresh clams in it, with every single shell having a plump clam inside.  (Pet Peeve:  when people give me shells with no meat inside!)  The cioppino is reportedly outstanding - and it looked good.  Again, the portions are notable.    The location is right by the water, and a bit detached from the main street.  It's on the fancier side of things - though a dress code is not really enforced.  The tables are rather close together.    This is a great place for a date or even a small business dinner - and prices are reasonable, especially considering its location and intended target. It's actually quite romantic and intimate, but because it's not secluded or private, it can appeal to just about anybody.  Scoma's has been around a long time, and has a loyal patronage - and after eating here once, I daresay it's well-deserved.  I would eat here again when I am craving fresh seafood, any day of the week!  As a sidenote, we had ordered the seafood platter hoping to gorge on cold seafood and white wine, but the waiter forgot and just served us our main entrees.  When we mentioned this, he was willing to fix the situation, but having seen the size of the entrees, we decided to skip the appetizer.  At the end of the meal, he comped us a dessert on the house and packed it for us to take with us.  Human error, but considering we were glad it didn't come, in hindsight, I thought it was a very kind gesture on his part.  Scoma's - try it!

Gz-x2k3hD_5doF77-oZ47w.review_text: Stopped in for dinner after a day touring Napa.  Had a short wait at the bar.  Bar crew was friendly and entertaining.  Service was great from wait-staff in white dinner jackets.  Food was well prepared and delicious. Very busy place at Fisherman's Wharf.

GRZXpYExGr8vcHSI2fk23g.review_text: We've been coming here for probably 30 years or so. It's become a tradition and we know there are much finer dining options in San Francisco and we know this is a tourist spot and we know, too, that it's on the pricey side. But the thing is: this is where my parents used to go when in town. It's where my siblings went as younger folk. So there are a lot of good memories wrapped up in lobster thermidor and fried calamari. Imagine - does any other place even have the ancient papyrus inscribed recipes for "thermidor?"  Look, it's almost guilty pleasure quality. The old furnishings, 1960-era wall photos, elderly waiters with photographic memories and reliably tasty chow combine for a nice Wharf evening, a chance to play or be a tourist. Jam in shoulder to shoulder, laugh, drink and order extra bread for your chowder or bisque!  It's now an institution and I guess my family is right - I need to be institutionalized, at least once in awhile. So, sue me for maudlin reviews but I like this old school joint and, darn that was some good petrale dore.

VWcuHdRuEenK6k11v1pvHQ.review_text: The food was 4 star.  The location is 5 star.  The ambience is dated but interesting, so 3 stars.  Our waiter was insulting and should be terminated. We were eventually served, so 1 star.  I have eaten here before and know better wait staff work here.   Ok food but a crap shoot on being served.

5j65nptHTM7E5G-Lclyz8Q.review_text: Scoma's was once my favourite, and the hidden gem of the Fisherman's Wharf... I stumbled upon it in 1999 and was completely blown away.  Fast forward 15 years, and I can honestly say that it's time for me to move on to another seafood restaurant.  We ordered a Caesar Salad, and the Hearts of Romaine Salad. The Caesar Salad was mediocre at best. I don't think salads are a strong suit there in general, so beware.  For our mains, we ordered the Fettuccine with Smoked Salmon and Shrimp... a total disappointment. I had this dish back in 1999, and at that time, the Salmon was HUGE along with the Shrimps. Over time, the Salmon became small strips, and the Shrimps were non-existent and tiny.  I expected the same kinds of amazing dishes that once wow'd me then, but Scoma's was certainly showing it's age, and times have changed. I was incredibly disappointed with my experience.  The only reason I gave it an extra star was only for the fairly prompt service. Otherwise, as much as I hate to do this, but it only deserves a one-star...  feel terrible doing it though.

gd1RhLvaN6Zs0iJyrcVGVQ.review_text: I come to Scoma's whenever I'm in San Francisco for my favorite clam chowder. The clam chowder at Scoma's is thick and tasty without being overly salty. I've also grown to love their calamari fritti and Dungeness crab cocktail! The Cioppino here is also one of the best I've had but my favorite is still the Cioppino at Phil's Fish Market.   The food here is good but pricy.

GArj6YRJL94AkOKsSkL3Rg.review_text: I came here for a Saturday lunch. This place is easy to miss because you have to drive into Al Scoma Way, a tiny road, to see the building. My boyfriend and I ordered from the DAT menu, at $17.95 a person for two courses. We both started out with the clam chowder and OMG, its so good! They do not jip you on the clams thats for sure. I can taste the sea with every bite. They also give you an entire loaf of sourdough bread for the table which goes well with the soup. Afterward, I had the scallops with mixed greens. The salad was very fresh and the scallops were melt in your mouth amazing. My boyfriend got the scallops with mashed potatoes. He enjoyed the scallops very much as well. The mashed potatoes weren't anything special though.   Service was good, food was yummy... despite its rather expensive regular menu, i'd love to come back!

FjMzwdvC8VEsrUu7E_76hQ.review_text: Go! Now! Stop Reading And Just Go! I went to this place for my birthday. It has become one of my top favorite seafood restaurants ever. Best oysters I've ever had. Great wine selection and the pricing is very reasonable. I brought along my friend that sells wine/sommelier. They were super impressed with the deal on such high quality wine. Great food. The staff was friendly and very helpful. GO NOW!

dfb8gr9dCLGZX0_HzfauRg.review_text: This was referred to from a seat mate in first class who's a local of SFO and he seemed to be a fairly well traveled gentleman and knows great food :)  With the bar set at ultimate high from previous night's dinner at Gary Danko, I knew it would be pretty tough to make a comparison as both are of the opposite spectrum. GD is a more upscale/dressy ambiance and this is suppose to be a bit more on the casual end but just as amazing in terms of food grade. We had a rsvp for 8:30, car serviced dropped us off at 8:25 and upon walking in, we were greeted with a sea of people hovering around where the reception area would be which I thought could use a little bit more organization but besides the point...proceeded to check in for our reservation and then we had to find a space to stand and wait for our names to be called over the intercom til our table was ready which was a good 15 minutes wait so I suggest getting there about 15 minutes prior to your rsvp, maybe more on a busy night (mind you this was a Monday night rsvp). So the seating promptness for a reservation was sub part at best and at this point I was just hoping for the meal to compensate for that and hopefully live up to the hype....IT DID!!!  The lobster bisque was delish. For my main course I went for the night's mixed grill option of 3 different types of uber fresh fish and jumbo shrimps on a bed of roasted vegetables and a hefty serving of mashed potato seasoned to perfection and a smoked salmon romoulade that was just soooo orgasmic. ..yes I said it.. which also paired really well with the bottle of WillaKenzie Estate pinot noir wine we had.  The serving was definitely hefty and filling that I couldn't even finished the rest of my meal. Overall, the meal definitely is worth the hype. Can't say much for the dessert menu as we never made it that far :)

yjG7OzHvhS6xl3D5HldaUw.review_text: I arrived to Scoma at around 7 PM on a Sunday night and it was PACKED. The worst thing about this restaurant is that there are NO RESERVATIONS, meaning that it takes forever for you to get seats. Thankfully, there's a full menu outside, and the view was just amazing.  It took an hour to get in. When I first sat down, I was immediately offered water and a bread basket. Bread was just whatever. And then I noticed...A VERY DIRTY SPOON. It wasn't even leftover residue from washing, it was CLEARLY unwashed. Server didn't seem TOO apologetic, just like oh sorry I'll fix it! Got a way cleaner spoon but that was disgusting.  The food came out really fast, and everything was delicious! I ordered a lobster ravioli and it was REALLY GOOD. Great lobster, not too heavy cream sauce, and delish. My date ordered the salmon and shrimp pasta fettucine and fairly enjoyed it.  Ended the night with a white chocolate garibaldi (white chocolate cheesecake tart baked with an oreo bottom) while he had tiramisu. The garibaldi was whatever, but good; his tiramisu was SCRUMPTIOUS. It came in a cup with a CHOCOLATE spoon and a biscotti! So cute!  It was definitely great, and would come here again...maybe just earlier. I can't wait to try all the other delicious dishes--their seafood is definitely fresh and amazing (:

_P8QjBKIPvZBbX25zHYSog.review_text: I have been going to Scoma's since I was a little girl.  I absolutely love this place.  Although I don't eat seafood, I love to sit and watch the seals in the water and enjoy the gorgeous view of the sunset from one of the many windows.  Their salads and nonseafood dishes are good as well.  And the service is impeccable!  You cannot visit the Bay Area without stopping at this restaurant.

jyV_D39wFTBxaQ6Un_OXWQ.review_text: Very good crab but the appetizers were just ok. The service was great but it was a little overpriced. The clam chowder was very fishy. It was a very romantic place though.

ljOSCLojeaQ336M59zEUKQ.review_text: Thank goodness for the Maps application on my iPhone. Scoma's is located right off Jefferson street, down an alley and next to the water. Great views of the marina and water!   The food here is solid! I loved the lobster bisque! So rich and creamy plus a bit of lobster pieces. This was my favorite part of my meal here! I ordered the rock shrimp and smoked salmon fettuccine. The shrimp and smoked salmon were cooked just right. Not overcooked at all. My only gripe with this dish was the over abundance of red onions! I like red onions, and a healthy addition of finely chopped pieces would be ok. Unfortunately, they put large slices that were overwhelming. Everyone else in my party was happy with their orders.  Seating here is kind of tight. The service was just ok. The host and our server lacked personality and enthusiastic service. Overall, good food and nice views. I definitely recommend to remedy those seafood cravings!

iC0jIdhBucaSDGWCHaSOsQ.review_text: Crab was ok. Didn't like the spinach on the side.

USaXB_eNYb9KcNtA9AvaXg.review_text: I absolutely loved Scoma's! Both my boyfried and I did the three course special for $40 (each) but I'm so glad we did.   The appetizer I chose was the dungeness crab cakes. OMG they were amazing!! I would definitely recommend those as a meal themselves. The main course I chose was the swordfish, which was perfectly cooked, although did have a bit of a bland flavor. For dessert I chose the pumpkin cheesecake. It was soooo good.   My boyfriend ordered the lobster bisque, ahi tuna and a dessert duo of tiramisu and bread pudding. The lobster bisque was the best I've ever had and same with the bread pudding!  I'm very picky when eating seafood and if it tastes at all fishy then I refuse to eat it. This was not a problem at Scoma's. Everything tasted fantastic! The food is a bit pricey (hence why we did the three course special) but the food is worth it.

KwBUiYqAs5w4EOjlzd-5Hw.review_text: service - 4 food - 4  salmon plate - was huuuuge~    chioppino - was huuuuge!  get the lazy mans if you don't want to deal with messiness.  i felt like the broth was a bit overpowered by all the tomato (but maybe it's supposed to be that way?) but all the seafood was super fresh and perfectly cooked.

SgDc-pcIm7RwgCh8y2XkFw.review_text: This place is really more about the old school atmosphere and ambiance. Our waiter Sal was great, exactly what you want for a nice dinner out. The location off of Fisherman's Wharf is very nice - away from the heavy tourist foot traffic, with all the fishing boats in view out the window giving diners a nice view.  The food, however, is good but not great. For the price I would have expected a better meal. My lobster ravioli was bland and boring. It was fine, just lacking any kind of wow factor. My wife's lemony shrimp and scallops were but dry with no side of butter or extra sauce accompanying them. For the price I would expect better.

uP8qLiZr5zH_5ziDL37S5A.review_text: Here fishy fishy fishy...  I love seafood.  One of my fave seafood places is Scoma's in SF.  I love everything I've ever had here.    The sourdough bread that they serve is so delicious.  I love sourdough bread with creamy butter.  I could totally make a meal of the bread and a cup of their yummy clam chowder.    Today I ordered the shellfish saute sec.  It has scallops, crab, shrimp and baby lobster tails in a most delicious sauce.  It is served over rice with penne pasta and veggies.  The portion is so large.  I was only able to eat about 1/4 of the order.  But oh that 1/4!  ;)  If you decide to go, just keep in mind that they don't take reservations.

VpCn3LJdDs3WO6ly64pzLQ.review_text: I've been here a couple times, the first about 3 years ago and the best of any.  I went again a few days ago because my mother was visiting from out of town and a friend had highly recommended the place to her.    First, the food was incredibly salty.  One bite from my boyfriend's steak and he didn't have to worry about me taking any more.  I definitely had several sips of water after that one.  The entire evening I found my self reaching for my water, something I rarely do when cooking for myself.  Fortunately the service was superb, the water server was there every second to refill our glasses.  Something tells me Scoma's knows it's over-salting and wants to make sure no one dehydrates while on their watch.  I can't say I need to go again but I sure hope I remember to tell them low or no salt if I do.  I almost forgot, watch out if you have a football fan with you, I found my boyfriend very distracted by the memorabilia near our table, actually I think it covered the entire room.  Perhaps request another seating area.

tkAjiVsQEhcVjc-0CKzcNg.review_text: Great combination of touristy San Francisco seafood but with quality good enough for locals.  I have been here several times and this was my best experience.  Started with the clam chowder, an old standby that they do well.  Normally I have the cioppino because I am in SF and have to but this time I had the Shrimp and Scallops alla Gannon.  Other than the fact it comes with two starches (rice and potatos) it was great, a tasty, butter garlic sauce and perfect shrimp and scallops.

k8cSnmzcdFFbbiE0HK89-A.review_text: Great wait staff. It is all about the.Italian Seafood. Lazy mans Choppinio, Crab Louie, Bread, Calamari steak. It is not cheap but is all on the plate. Lots of Locals who like the food.  I always hit this restaurant when I am in San Francisco.

WQUdPr-LA_VvPCeHn4tbSw.review_text: The view of this restaurant was beautiful! Right on the water with views of beautiful boats and we even saw a seal while dining! :) I started with the lobster bisque which was delicious and I actually wish I would have gotten a bowl of this as my meal! For my entree, I ordered the fried scallops, which came with rice and mixed veggies. The portion was a really nice size- definitely on the larger side which was good, considering it was over $30. However, the meal was just kind of bland- nothing really had any flavor.  My colleague ordered a caesar salad to start with mussels as her main dish. She said she left feeling satisfied but nothing to write home about. I think this place probably has some amazing dishes that they are known for but overall I would say it was decent place with higher prices but great views!

uhk0McY6qtKHIaqrXw4d3A.review_text: Very promising venue, yet very disappointing food.   This place has all the great clues for a "find". You pass many other restaurants in a tourist mecca on your way walking there. It is just slightly off the beaten path. It looks very unassuming from the outside. The interior looks like it was hip when Frank Sinatra was in his 20's and it hasn't been updated, making you think it is so great that they don't need to modernize the decor. "Yes" you think, "I have found a secret gem!"  Sadly, the food disappoints. The wait time for a table, the dated interior, and the inferior view are just predictions of your mediocre meal. Bland, predictable, and easily surpassed by other restaurants in the same area....our favorite is the Franciscan a few blocks away.

J578YvvWaeks5M-QKD7MWA.review_text: I was very disappointed in Scomas. I had heard many good things and it was average at best. For the price you pay, it should be some of the best seafood you've ever had. It was ok. If the prices were cut in half, I'd go back because the food was average. But for me, it's not worth the price you pay.

43gffDcxSzpNoI0Py2BU9A.review_text: As if the excellent food weren't enough, the customer service is Old World sophisticated, Our waiter was a delight and did not steer us wrong with the entree suggestions.  I had the salmon and shrimp pasta.  For a person who NEVER eats pasta, I splurged this evening and am so glad I did.  It was phenomenal. Though pricey, if you are looking for that one nice/pricey meal for your trip, Scoma's is a can't miss.

jAgVo3cDs0wI-d9c6LfBog.review_text: Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Very flexible in improvising meals. Portions were offensively large and presentation was less than impressive. Just LOTS of food....sort of thrown on a plate hapharzardly. Food was ok.

0RHUgJ-dwwu7fR_FtzOh2w.review_text: Lobster bisque! It's all I think about, it's what gets me through the day. We come here on impromptu dates, I've always seen it from the pier by the Musee Mechanique side of the Wharf and wanted to try it, so one evening when we were wondering where we could eat and we were starved we skipped on over to Scoma's...  I love the cheesy decore, it's like time travelling, but a little bit less of a hassle :)  I had the Lobster Bisque, well we each had a bowl, and it was so good. Then i had the Crab Ravioli, combining all of my favorites of sea food, Lobster, Crab and Pasta... yumm!!!! Truly hit the spot, but since we are a young couple on a budget, we decided that next time we could live without the $30 pasta dish and just each have the bisque and fill up on bread and butter. So that's what we do.   Such a great view of the bay and wonderful friendly service, our fave waiter is Andrew, and the best Bisque in the Bay.

VgGeJDT-HUq60HwjMMzJcw.review_text: terrible experience, nowhere close to three stars, service is ok, but the food, terrible. Both me and my wife have had stomach ache and diarrhea 10 mins after the appetizer (and we haven't eat anything else that day). chef didn't come and explain, we were still being charged for the full course.  (review written by zmacs in 2012)

A4WrL2qv3hu_8aEo6TKpbg.review_text: Great seafood place! Came here with my family. They had lobster bisque, which was creamy but not too thick, the dungeness crab was pretty good, and the halibut and  swordfish was fantastic not fishy tasting at all! I couldn't decide what I wanted so the waitress had the chef cook something for me with crabs that wasn't even on the menu! Talk about great customer service! Great food, great service, what more can I ask for?

jeokFgURb-_Yo_McZFBS0Q.review_text: This is one of those places where the average patron is probably not well represented by the the reviewers on Yelp.  That is, those who dine here are predominantly over 40 and likely not so swept up in the fever to write reviews on the interwebs... which leaves us young'nes to continue thinking we know what we're talking about.  Anyway, the waiters, a few of whom are sprightly old Chinese men, don tuxedos and can speak eloquently and exhaustively about the menu.  The portions are large and the plating is no-nonsense.  The atmosphere is lively and old-fashioned with just the right amount of swank.  I'll try for a review update when I actually have something to say about the food.

5cUVYZlmUCwqlOxBVP15Lw.review_text: Scoma's was amazing.  My girlfriend was dying to bring me here, so when we went I had high expectations.   They were all met.  The ambiance is classic 70s wharf, and the history is palpable.  I believe some of the wait staff may be early generation employees.    The food is phenomenal.  I still dream of the swordfish my girlfriend ordered.  Everything was seasoned perfectly, and the portions are on the heavier side of hearty.  Both of us were up later that night scarfing down on our leftovers.

F_HrijiA7kdN0TX9mSl2ZQ.review_text: The seafood in the lazy man cioppino lacked flavor. The broth was just bland tomato soup. The seafood is fresh, just very lacking in the flavor department. The fried calamari was good, soft chewy texture with dipping sauces. Clam chowder was good, full of chunks of clams.  The service was good, did all the basics: greet you, seat you, take your order, check up if the food was good, etc.   Be warned, they make their mixed drinks strong, which makes for a good value but it's a little much for dinner.

C4OkiPljZ3z2XUa7onmihQ.review_text: This place is always good.  Had the halibut broiled and it was freakin unbelievable.  It's like getting a filet that's perfectly between medium rare and medium.  Fantastic.  The swordfish piccata was outstanding as well.  The frank family cab was very good.  I would just say that they should spill a little more in the glass.  The spumoni was very good and little espresso to boot.  Just a consistent place.  Go there.

9lAicAw7kzNqaumpKoh-VA.review_text: We were excited by all the seafood options and so went a little overboard.  We started with the Hot appetizer for two. Delicious shrimp, yummy calamari, but the highlight was by far the crab cakes.  Yummy!  I had the Scallops and prawns. So good. Beautifully sautéed and firm but not rubbery or stringy. Just pure scallopy goodness!  My boyfriend had a lightly breaded fish, which I thought was delicious, but breaded fish wasn't really his thing... so ask because the menu doesn't give a lot of details.  Scoma's is old-school.  Decor is all wood-panelling and the servers are uniformed with those old-fashioned jackets.  Maybe it could use a bit of a facelift but it was a lovely romantic dinner for two!

_owMBYfzT9dO7FXGXXzXqA.review_text: Scoma's may have been known for seafood, views, and service in 1965, but it's been completely outdone by a plethora of restaurants in SF since then. My girl friends and I came for Dine About Town a few days ago because $35.95 for a three-course dinner seemed like a steal in light of entrees costing that much alone here.   I chose the dungeness crab cakes, the lamb T-bones with parmesan polenta, and the pumpkin cheesecake. Nothing was bad, but everything was bland. For example, the crab cakes could have benefited from a curry or garlic aioli; the lamb would have been tastier with a balsamic vinegar glaze; the cheesecake should have had a thicker graham cracker crust. Dinner didn't appear to be a deal after I tasted the food.  I was also peeved that the host promised us a 40-minute wait (Scoma's doesn't take reservations), which actually turned into a 1-hour 10-minute wait. It's always better to estimate liberally. If I knew we had to wait that long, I would've just dined at another restaurant.   The view IS easy on the eyes, though.    Scoma's is yet another old, semi-stuffy restaurant that makes you wonder how it's still surviving and thriving in a city with over 4,500 restaurants, many of them serving delicious food at reasonable prices. How many licks does it take to get to the center of a tootsie pop? Nobody knows.

SwkOkqY5gdE1OFKYX4DnLA.review_text: Fresh king salmon season   Grilled with aldente veggies   Excellent.   Fresh steamed crab super.  Spoon bread/crab w salad yum. Dungeness crab rissoto terrific

UdRoRiQegstVzcrahOv5rg.review_text: Great place! We had a tentative, friendly, funny waiter which we enjoyed. He had the old- school waiter vibe which is dying out across America. I came here with my daughter, mother and aunt. We got there around two, famished from walking the three of us ordered the prix fixe lunch. Which is a 3 course meal for $24.95- what a deal! We also ordered a bottle of Reisling, Saint M, which was priced well at $32. We got a cup of creamy clam chowder with a lot of clam pieces. Then all three of us ordered the pasta Garibaldi, which was sooo rich in flavor, once again no skimp on the fish. I swear each of us had over 30 small scallops, mussels and salmon pieces. That was the highlight of our meal and we all agreed the best main course in our 3 day trip. The dessert was a chocolate cheesecake with raspberry sauce. My family said it was really good, sadly I didn't have a bite being I'm allergic to chocolate, but I'm sure it was good. My daughter had the chicken tenders on the kids menu which she ate and she is very picky how certain restaurants season their chicken tenders. After leaving my daughter said she forgot her bag full of candy she had purchased in her chair. She was worried that someone already picked up her bag, We went back and the hostesses were sweet and said they had her bag and joked with her that they were about to eat the peeps if she hadn't returned. We will definitely visit Scomas again and recommend to all. Thank you for a great dining exeperience.

t1BFxagTLj_NRFd8_nn7pw.review_text: Ate dinner at Scoma's tonight with my new Husband - we are on our honeymoon in San Francisco.  The tour bus driver highly recommended Scoma's as the best seafood restaurant in the area.  When we walked over I was a bit skeptical.  I'm so glad I stayed.  The food was outstanding and our waiter, John, had worked there for over 20 years - he was absolutely the best.  We had a remarkable meal and a memorable date night out.  Thank you John and Scoma's for a great memory.  We will definitely be back!

Lm4oFlebM1U6Yj0cYYbqow.review_text: My boyfriend took me here, and at first, we couldn't find the place!  It's in hidden view, behind some buildings near the dock.  When we got there, I was instantly reminded of a country club with a lot of older americans dressed in sports jackets and sunday dresses.  I was a bit skeptical at first.  Our waiter was hilarious!  He kept cracking jokes, although he was probably in his mid 60's!  We ordered the dungeness and prawn cocktail, and I absolutely loved it!  I am a huge prawn fan, and this was hands-down the BEST prawn cocktail I have ever had.  In addition, the dungeness crab was already taken out of the shell, making it easy to eat.  For my entree, I got the Fisherman Style Pasta: Crabmeat, Bay Shrimp, Onions and Mushrooms in Tomato Sauce.  The sauce was too watery, and they were skimpy on the seafood.  I was expecting amazing seafood given that we were RIGHT NEXT TO THE DOCK ON FISHERMAN'S WHARF!  I was horribly disappointed.    Overall, great service and appetizer.  Not so good seafood pasta.

a0mC6Gf7S99YNKmK6_aFzA.review_text: We were looking so some place to have dinner on a cold San Francisco night. The taxi driver recommended this restaurant at the end of an ALLEY! That made us a bit hesitant, but we gave it a shot, we thought what could go wrong?.... :) this place was packed to the ceiling with peoplez. Our table had a nice view of the marina and we got started. Our server was a bit "tipsy" but all was good. I had the grilled cod which was good and my aunt and uncle had the swordfish which was delicious!! I didn't want dessert but they did and they got the apple crisp a la mode. They said it didn't taste that good and it looked mushy, a look a bit unappetizing. The food was reasonably priced. Just wish the dessert was better, but will go back, just not for dessert. :)

YoRWTxlP-6OeOp46SJ1k8w.review_text: Great food and possibly the BEST service I've ever received. We went on a night that SF got a rare late fall thunderstorm. With a neat view of the Bay, it made for a pretty cool experience. Dungeness season had just opened so tried a roasted crab. Being raised on Blue Crab, there was a bit of a let-down in the flavor department, but the dish was prepared extremely well and tasted great.  Portions are huge and it is pricey. A nice occasion restaurant.

b_Uiy1m7QNoDpzB8MnpHOg.review_text: The Cioppino was really flavorful and had a ton of seafood in it. You could probably get one to share. It is really filling and comes with a side of bread you can dip in the sauce.   The drinks were strong and yummy. I had the peartini and the golden gate sunrise.   The wait staff was incredibly friendly. It had a lively and fun atmosphere and the restaurant is right on the water front. I would visit again even though it was a bit pricy.

7wnzvLrD3sGuJkMYRNvhDA.review_text: Consistently great every time I venture to the tourista neighborhood known as the wharf.  If Gary Danko won't seat you at a decent time head over to Scoma's for extremely fresh seafood (they have their own receiving station at the dock next to the restaurant) and great sourdough bread.  In the many times I've been there always delicious are the Seafood Saute, lazy mans cioppino, petrale sole, and of course the clam chowder.  Dropped $120 for two with tax, tip and drinks.  A great deal considering how much delicious food you get to bring home in a doggy bag.    Best seafood joint in the wharf area by far.  Hard to be a San Franciscan and not eat here.

5eF_cjTi1N7o1FfaP8BM9Q.review_text: Great food and service! Only problem was hostesses inability to estimate wait time. Original estimated wait time for party of five: 20min, actual time: an hour and five minutes.

_vxpX15CulndAauKIJ4VWw.review_text: My wife and I have eaten here most every time we come to the city for some 40 years. The last time (forever) was 4 years ago.  The best feature was the valet parking, I'm sorry to report. It was  like a tourist trap,run 'em in get 'em out. The food was memorable only for being over priced. What a great restaurant has thus become. Truly a disappointment, there are many fine dining restaurants who are the recipients of our patronage. Too bad.

izJJZhhy2YJG8hUnNNRVxA.review_text: Check it out - If you are a seafood lover, I suggest you find your way to the Wharf, and go to Scoma's!! Yes, it is somewhat pricy, but 100% worth it. I would suggest the Pasta Diplomatica. It is spaghetti style pasta with petit lobster tails, prawns, clams, and sea scallops in a cream sauce. Boy this is an awesome dish, and I have never gone home with a doggie bag. The service is excellent, and you get a lovely view of the beautiful San Francisco Bay.  Make sure you find your way here!

ZxvaErjVi8OKu_fxR_a-3A.review_text: Good food, all seafood is very fresh, reasonable price, impressive service, Lillian is the best server, She is very helpful and sweet.

fLwVV89u4chh2mQ8eaTAIw.review_text: I had to get Dungeness crab before returning from a trip to San Francisco, and I had to dine with my suitcase to do so. I wasn't disappointed. I first had the scrumptious bisque, and the crab was nothing short of amazing.  I might have been willing to be clawed by Oscar (my name for my crustacean) to taste his delectable pinchers, though that would have made it difficult to crack the shell. I was willing to sacrifice my cholesterol reading to dip my legs (rather, his) into the melted butter.  Very old-school waiter in dress and manner provided exquisite service, especially for such a casual place. And I thought the place would be over-run by tourists. Certainly the majority were, but not the "overrunning types." This might be because the place is a block toward the bay from Beach Street. I only found it through Yelp. Great public transportation nearby, including the classic, antique streetcars that go to the Ferry Building.  Beautiful location, on a dock right on the bay, with what look like fishing boats on the dock (not many of these left on the piers anymore). A perfect, final meal before I left the city.

8g7IvR1ZGPaRRS9i_U_4sw.review_text: This place was amazing! The salmon was super fresh and prepared perfectly. My husband had the lobster tail. It was huge and so tasty. The service was great. It was the best meal I have ever had in San Fran.

zJNqylLmbH-viISElrhAGg.review_text: This place is weak.  It is basically a tourist trap.   Everything on the menu is over 30 dollars.  I hate all of the tourists down at Fishermans Wharf.  If you want to buy a 75$ surf and turf go here

cFXEfwiQgWhaTBZ_CaaZ_w.review_text: We were walking around Pier 39 and decided to go here with our little girl for lunch.  They were great with our 2 year old.  The food was pretty good but very pricey for lunch (what else would you expect at Pier 39).  Clam chowder was above average, crab cakes as well.  The petrale dole was good but would have been better with some tartar sauce.  My wife had the pasta that came with the pre fixed lunch menu and she liked it.  Only down side was that our server forgot to bring out my sprite and instead of serving my fish with mashed potatoes like I asked for, it came with penne.  She did try to make up for it by not charging for the sprite and a side of mashed for free which was appreciated, but she still did forget two of my items.  I do think it was just a bad day for her and would not hold it against the restaurant.  We would go back for a special occasion

vAkpKtEvDxxavhva_vAIxw.review_text: This place was recommended by a friend, so we tracked it down on the pier. The food was incredible. We had a simple lunch, which included the clam chowder and the butternut squash soup. We nearly lucked our bowls! The sourdough bread was delish, especially with the chowder. The hostess was prompt in seating us and polite. I liked the sports memorabilia in the decor. The family running this place clearly has their act together. Thank you for great food and service!

BUT5nRU7jQ2WMU5Afrgheg.review_text: People I mention this place to were super down on it as it was too touristy.  I came on a cold (for NorCal) January weeknight.  It was all local regulars.  No families, kids, tourists, etc...  The staff are all old-timers, some who have a ton of energy and some who seem like they need to retire because they don't give a shit anymore and really aren't that interested in making your evening memorable.  The food was great for what I'd expect there - I had the lobster bisque, a seafood pasta, and the tiramisu was like 10 stars.  Seriously get the tiramisu.  I also had a few drinks and the bartenders seemed like pretty awesome people; low key, friendly, made great drinks.    I'd go back on a sunny day and see the water!  Great location.

Rzm2psMUuhe8bwPeAymd3Q.review_text: I don't eat fish anymore, so even though I would never have gone back, I certainly now never will.  It's an overrated, uninspired, expensive, mediocre, fish-restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf that did absolutely nothing for me.  Don't miss it; never did.  I had ordered the tuna steak, and instead of being sashimi quality, thick cut, it was thin, almost as if it had been pounded out, and served medium well (despite my request for rare).  The salad was also nothing to rave about.

nW8ujzozMdCPeEhD-_QRcA.review_text: I've been to scomas many times and it is excellent every time. The service for this past visit was personable and fast. I loved the sole (fish dore), the recommendation of our waiter. It was a huge portion size but very delicious. Scomas may be a little touristy but it's well worth it!

SjX_4tpusPeZd_5a7txkXQ.review_text: Came here with a party of 10 for a friends birthday dinner and the bill turned out to be $82 a person including tip, not bad, not bad at all.  You can also drive into the restaurant and valet the car for free.  We ordered a variety of appetizers, the main appetizers that stood out = the large crab cakes, the large shrimp cocktails and the raw oysters.  I ordered the lobster tail entree and the crab cake entree,.   I was already sick from eating all the crab cakes during our first course and when the CC entree came,.. I just shared this amongst my section.  However, my lobster tail was yum,. yum,. scoma's don't kid around when they say "the lobster tails are huge",. refer to my photo.   I would have given this restaurant another star or two,. but our waiter was not professional at all,. might I add LAZY and INATTENTIVE.  He was an older, big, bald caucasian man,.. I forgot his name though.  Anywho, I asked for paper napkins, because I don't feel comfortable using the white towel napkins to wipe my mouth.  He came back with a few paper napkins and placed it near my glass of wine (paper napkins that was only enough for me and two friends).  A friend of mine, down the other end of the table of 10,. also asked for paper napkins,.. he walks over and reaches over me and grabs the pile of napkins that I had originally asked for and passed it down the table.  Seriously? I see that as LAZY, he could have went and got some more napkins.  All of us just stared at him in shock?! and I'm sure he didn't even notice,. b/c if he did noticeee,.. next complaint,..     Not only that,. when pouring us wine. He dripped wine after each glass,. going from one glass to another,. red wine = obviously red stains on the white table cloth?! HELLO?! Seems like I was being poured hennessy shots with no control.  The other -1 star is the dirty utensils.  The glasses were filthy, including the eating utensils,. my fork had chunks of gunk sticking on it and to add,. one of my friends water glass was cracked and the waiter totally forgot to bring her back another water, until asked the second time.   The food was delicious, the hassle free of looking for parking is a plus,. but the "dirty dishes" and "lazy, inattentive waiter" will not cut it.  Maybe its because I had high expectations coming into dinner, especially with the big star ratings,. I was hoping at least, my eating utensils can be clean/germ free?!

LXU5DNadcKcHroqZfWL5kg.review_text: The outside isn't much to look at, but don't let it fool you....this place is fantastic! After being disappointed by multiple restaurants near the wharf, my husband and I decided to give this place a try. Both the clam chowder and lobster bisque were excellent. Not only was the food delicious, our waitress was very friendly and helpful! It is a little pricey, but not much more than other restaurants near by, and this one is far superior!

PrMHrCOY6rltnirFlF7FiQ.review_text: I love the family feel of the restaurant.  It's so cute.  My favorite dishes are the lobster bisque and the steamed dungeonness crab.  I will definitely be back when I'm having a seafood craving.

83zq60Wt8HDr9Lh1gIOWSA.review_text: I have a simple view on Fisherman's Wharf - if you must eat here, then you must go to Scoma's. I've gone to Scoma's for years, and you can bank on very fresh seafood in a comfortable yet a bit old school establishment. And that's a good thing - just flashy enough to dress up a bit if you like but still comfortable if you've been out doing the tourist thing and need a great late lunch break. On the last visit I had sand dabs, and they were absolutely perfect, the light sweetness of the fish offset with the lemon and capers. A crisp California white wine and some great sourdough bread just made it a perfect and simple meal.  Oh, and if you wonder what other locations I recommend in the Wharf area, it's easy - I don't.

EHjp3-183IXI-sC0yluZwg.review_text: Nearly 600 reviews and a solid 4-stars can't be wrong.   Delicious Italian food and amazing Cioppino. If you're in the San Francisco area, you must eat here. Expect to wait (even with a reservation), but enjoy the location and have a drink.

z26-1gC14g4fe5wqbn4rJw.review_text: The only drawback of this restaurant is its location, besides that, everything about this place is wonderful.  The staff is defiantly above average, and the food is amazing.  They serve excellent crab cakes, not a lot of breading.

rCTnjBaN2y_D0DFs24Ae5Q.review_text: Fish : A+ Service: A+  Wish they would put more on the plate!!!!

NRrNQ5xHn_7Fu4ctlpKLbQ.review_text: I nominate Scoma's as the flagship classic seafood restaurant for San Francisco. All seafood restaurants will be compared to this gem from this day forward. Go here now. The portions are huge and preparation perfect.  Service was excellent and the food was unparalleled.   Me - Crab cakes with sauce - 5 stars. These were the best Crab cakes I've had in recent memory. Girlfriend - Fish soup "It's like a little aquarium in my bowl." Drinks are OK.  Valet parking is free. This is old school, not some hip fusion place with dancing girls.

jB8g5SfQ4s9gh3it6M1KWw.review_text: Old school San Fran rest. right on the wharf.  Appetizers - Crab cakes were perfect.  Entrees - Swordfish piccatta was very good. Moist, not dry at all.                  Patrale could have been better( a little dry ), but still good.

R7u3c15wPOAjpO_aaC-zEg.review_text: We arrived around 5ish on a Monday afternoon and still had to wait a bit.  Not sure why we had to wait that long since there weren't that many people in the restaurant.  Anyway, we finally got seated approx 15mins later and were seated next to the window/pier view, so I had no compliant there.  We didn't order much since we were eating the entire day.  Below were the 2 items we ordered to share among the 4 of us:  - Crab Risotto with mushroom ragout and sweet peas - this was pretty good and not too heavy.  - Lazy Man's Cioppino - prawns, shrimps, clams, sea scallops, fresh fish and a  1/2 Dungeness crab in a rich tomato broth - WOW.. I've never eaten SO MUCH fresh seafood in one dish.  It was almost like endless seafood within this bowl.  The 4 of us couldn't completely finish this because there was SO MUCH seafood.  And let me tell you, it is ALL worth the extra few bucks to get the "Lazy Man" version so you don't have to crack the shell out yourself.

isC4-oLc-TqPXYlUmuHLdA.review_text: Overpriced and crowded. I've been here twice and think I"ll try someplace else. The food is fine, not spectacular as the prices imply. Just one of those old SF establishments that doesn't have to try to hard.

D9LazaU-tCefsCGCqlEuog.review_text: In the mood for some seafood? Scoma's won't disappoint.  I came here for dinner and from the service to the food, everything was great! It's been 6 hours since I ate and I'm still in a food coma! When we arrived, we were greeted and seated within a minute literally. Bread and breadsticks were brought to our table and I must note, that although I did not fill up on it, they gave a nice big portion of bread cut into thick slices. Umm, BONUS POINTS! I hate when restaurants give you a ration of bread that barely feeds the pigeons outside and you have to flag down a server for more. Not at Scoma's!    But on to the food.....I ordered the pasta diplomatica which had petite lobster tails, scallops, clams, and prawns in a creme sauce. My friend had something that came with some scrumptious mashed potatoes, steamed veggies, and prawns that were the size of my face! Ok, not that big but they were literally the size of my entire palm...which is still damn big! My pasta had a very generous portion of fresh seafood. The scallops were large and amazing! I had no complaints.  The service was great. Probably one of the best I have had in a long time. They were attentive without being bothersome....that is skill, seriously. Kudos to them!  If you are looking for some new, inventive, knocks you to the floor seafood, I wouldn't say that Scoma's does that. What I will say is if you want fresh seafood, a generous portion, and cooked well, then you definitely should try Scoma's.

cnVxeco9iKF0et5YZvKrsg.review_text: I don't really know about everyone else - but I don't believe my experience is of the best as to be expected of this class of restaurant. The wait time was long, and the person running the front end is not truthfully forthcoming and accurate with wait times. The service was slow, expect to wait at least thirty minutes before you even get a glass of hydrogen hydroxide to consume after taking a seat.  We've basically ordered food for everyone at the group to try, the steak was meh - not the best steak when compared to Les Halles New York or even Bouchon Las Vegas. It was flavorless meat - hardly any substance or actual enjoyment to it.  I had lobster - and I'm really not that impressed. I believe it was overcooked - dry, and overpowering with seasonings. The crab stuff mushroom was not the best either.  The vegetables were bland, and the rice was dry and overcooked. I know what rice tastes like - as I tend to eat it everyday, and their rice is a place I would expect from something of a fast casual restaurant, not here.  Maybe it's because I'm a native of Seattle Seafood, or that I cook seafood myself - but I'm really not pleased with this restaurant and it's service and the quality of the food that was served given the prices listed.  I would suggest looking elsewhere if you're in the mood for a seafood dining.

w9xWb9UPxTqOzkLIdHqk8g.review_text: The best seafood restaurant in my opinion.Very Fresh.  They undeniably have the best crab louie I have ever eaten.  I also love their clam chowder and the swordfish con faggiole is yummy. Ask for Hero, our favorite waiter on staff.  They also have valet parking at no charge.  Scoma's is our favorite restaurant...definately worth the drive.

931NrRnIU20iyMlTNUXfWw.review_text: I came with some friends for Dine About Town on a Sunday at 7:15 PM. We were seated at around 8:10, but we didn't start getting food until 9:05, which was a bit disappointing. I know it was busy, but it took nearly 25 minutes for the waiter to finally get down our order. Now onto the food:  Appetizer: Lobster Bisque - This bisque was delicious and packed a lot of flavor without being too much. I've had lots of bisques in the past that were very salty, but this was a good balance. It also had a bit of a spicy kick at the end of every bite.  Clam Chowder - This was not your typical clam chowder to say the least... I personally felt it lacked flavor. My friend described it as chicken noodle soup-esque and I have to agree. It was a bland chicken noodle soup with cream and clams instead of chicken.  Entrees: Seared Scallops over Linguine - I only had a taste of the scallops, so I can't comment on the pasta. The scallops were nicely cooked, had a good texture but it lacked the sweetness that I usually expect from them.  Lamb T-Bones - This was definitely the highlight of the evening for me. I asked for my lamb to be medium rare, and out come 3 good looking pieces of lamb. One of the pieces was a perfect medium, while the other 2 were perfect medium-rares - weird. it was seasoned well and the lamb was soft and amazing. the juices of the lamb seeped into the spinach and that was incredible as well.  Dessert: Tiramasu and Sourdough Breading Pudding - I love bread pudding, but I'm probably not going to order a sourdough one again. The raisins tasted sour after the caramel on top of the sourdough. That's just too much sour for me in a bread pudding. The tiramasu was great though. The coffee flavor had a little, but just enough sweetness to make this good for a fan of bittersweet things.  tl;dr - the wait was long, the portions are huge, would only come back for the bisque and lamb

k01wJVidSdGgTyipFPnXSQ.review_text: Scoma's is an outstanding seafood restaurant. The volume of seafood they sell everyday is the most in the United States. It is not just the quantity but the outstanding quality of their seafood. The restaurant is always crowded, but they have a bar where you can wait and a highly efficient staff that seats you as promptly as possible. The food was delicious. I recommend the Cioppino which is a fisherman's stew of seafood invented in San Francisco by the Italian fisherman some years ago. The ravoili was delicious as well and portions are very large. The seafood is very fresh. Highly recommended.

vxG7J3h_MGX4Www60WyDVA.review_text: Overrated... pretty much sums it up for our experiences here. One of four plates was definitely worth it (the yellowfin), another would barely cut it for what I'd expect for this type of restaurant. The other two were just boring and lacking in flavor. The atmosphere was noisy and our server could have easily been a bit more courteous. For the price, don't take the gamble and go somewhere else.

KXw5PSJqOHxKgLzmlAOZZg.review_text: ,,,,,Thanks to Yelps inept handling of their "Hornblower Cruise" we wound up at Scomas....less said about Yelp the better.  They sent out thousands of invitations to their Yelp favorites and "Vendors" who pay them for glowing reviews.  I got an invite and RSVP as asked.  We arrived on time and were denied boarding because we weren't on their preferred guest list.  No class operation.   .....anyhow being adults we decided to enjoy our own company and the beautiful day and walk up the Embarkadaro.  A tourist couple asked about the Waterfront Restaurant, I said I wouldn't go if they were buying, so recommended Scomas down on the Wharf.  As we walked along Pier 39 we ran into some old friends we hadn't seen in years who were also out enjoying the wonderful Summer like day... ....Told them about the Yelp screw up as we walked along...they hadn't been to Scomas in years...let's go.  The meal and adult conversation couldn't been better.   .....The Fetichini Alfredo with clams, lobster, shrimp and scallops...excellent  The Caesars salad and tall Tanqaray Tonic excellent...best of all the adult company... We all toasted Yelp and their strange way of doing business.....Fair warning...the tab we picked up was $200...

iHVE2rY2N6X8XORc7HYeAw.review_text: I actually forgot the exact name of my dish but it was basically Parmesan encrusted sole fillet with some other things (Ha!) and it was super delicious. Its located in a nice area so it had a nice view if you sit by the window it even outdoors.  Their clam chowder is also a good choice if you're looking for a nice meal and don't want to pay $20 for your dinner.

c_AoxAZ-AjamrsYq5VQyrQ.review_text: Sand Dabs!  We love Sand Dabs. This N California treat is not always available or well prepared. Buy Scoma's is beautifully prepared. The staff is very attentive and seems to have been there a long time. The bread was so good we took ours with us. A lovely experience.

JmarPUDYALd9cmjItEA6og.review_text: My bf treated me to this hidden restaurant for our 5 year anniv. (Yea, like a boss haha) The service from everyone but our server was superb. I was impressed with the food and the selection.Of course, as expected, the seafood was very fresh. My man got the salmon and it tasted like it was just caught. My crab cakes could have been cooked better. It wasn't as crispy as I'd like it to be. But the person who made this place a good experience was the older gentleman asian buss boy. He was very polite and attentive, always refilling my ice tea and checking up on us. Our server was pretty absent. I was upset because it took more than 5 minutes for him to even come over and greet us. He seriously took our order and took our credit card. The buss boy deserved the $5 tip I slipped to him secretly.   I'd come back but just beware the service may be hit or miss depending on if you look like you'd leave a good tip or not. Obviously our server made a major mistake. I'm a working woman mister!

0lWRenKpvhyG5hRu39CgLA.review_text: Scoma's Restarants Pier 47 Al Scoma Way San Francisco, CA 94133 Neighborhood: Fisherman's Wharf (415) 771-4383 scomas.com . Great portion,good price. Always make reservations. One hour wait on weekends.

sMYNkPn5ecal3w2f48wO6A.review_text: Greatest place to visit in San Francisco. Hellava Martini and Shrimp Cocktail!

8C4PFBKUVNq0M3rNJSxoAQ.review_text: 2Stars $$$ Disappointing over price, must have new cheap owners $40 Chopino is now served with no crab, service was terrible you had to ask for missing items n more bread n butter. Crowed n they pack u in tight. Valet parking. Table with views are rare have to be persistent.

Ag6w9WoQsHs7LoOUeIn92w.review_text: I decided to give this place a try based on all the amazing reviews and I'm glad I did. This place was amazing I got the catch of the day salmon blackened the seasoning was beyond amazing ! My brother got the salmon broiled which was also good if you don't like a lot of spices go with that one . We also got the ahi tuna which wasn't the best . The service on the other hand was a little frustrating not really that helpful. Overall I'm really happy we tried it

1jZ93gJ368qdjFY5Aw2ZNg.review_text: Overhyped sea food restaurant. Food was ok but not great. Service was mediocre. Prices too high for what you get. Generic sea food.

eGNDMI3F8d4VoAe9CYGSzw.review_text: I give it a 3 stars because Dine About Town was not the business. First, our lobster bisque and crab cake portion for starters were tiny! Paper thin pieces for crab cakes and less than a cup for the bisque.  Second, we ordered the pork with chimmichuri sauce and it was the dryest pork I had ever eaten. There was no gloss to it as there should be with meat when cooked to order. We also ordered the seared ahi, which was just okay. It was too done and not satisfying, but tasted better than the pork. Last, dessert.  We got the tiramisu and the sorbet. The tiramisu was in this tiny espresso cup!!! Literally a few bites of this. Dissapointed. Overall, my boyfriend and I were disappointed with this Dine About Town experience.

3w1X67Ktt7lrnY7WlYgfbw.review_text: Great meal!!  We arrived late on a Friday night and the restaurant served us a delicious, fresh seafood meal.  We were thrilled!!

QIta4g4-1fciUDzJg7Ug3A.review_text: I can't figure out all the great reviews for this place.  The last time I had a great meal here was around 1975.  30 plus years ago this place was the bomb.  Now it's just a tourist trap.  The prices are outrageous for the quality of food that they serve.  In the 70's it was great, kind of a dive that few knew about with great food at a good price.  I ate there quite a bit then especially when out of town relatives showed up.  Around 1998 I tried it again after not having been there for quite a few years.  I remember I was sorely disappointed, high prices, dry fish, and everything a la carte.  I remember nothing came with my entree.  Fast forward to present day and my niece and her husband who moved here 3 years ago now say they love it and have been there 5 times already.  I agree to give it another try since my sister is here from Chicago and is open to it too.   We had to wait about 45 minutes, the place was pretty full, so I thought maybe everyone else knew something I did not.  Once we got seated and I perused the menu I was even more shocked by the prices.  Art least they do now include sides with some of the entrees.  I still could not bear to order some of these entrees at 30 dollars and up even though my sister was paying.  I decided to opt for a shrimp and crab open face sandwich at $17 figuring it might be pretty good since it's hard to ruin something like that.  My niece ordered an appetizer of mozzarella in a spicy tomato sauce which I tried.  Nothing to write home about, the sauce was OK but I thought a pretty small portion for the price.  My sandwich arrived with fries and a salad.  Salad was lettuce with 1000 island dressing and a few beets on the side. I've had better at a diner.  Fries were hot but nothing special.  The sandwich was on a huge thick piece of toasted sourdough.  The only thing on it was mayo and the shrimp was on one side, the crab on the other.  The only way to eat it was with a knife and fork.  The bread was so hard I almost asked for a steak knife to cut it as I had to saw and saw to get through it with a regular knife.  The shrimp was OK, a  little seasoning might have helped.  By the time I got to the crab, I gave up on eating the bread and ate just the crab. It was watery and tasteless except for salt.  Yuck!  With all the wonderful seafood restaurants in SF, this place should be at the bottom of the list.  I much prefer Pacific Cafe and for crab you can't beat Thanh Long.  We had a wonderful meal at Chapeau's the night before so maybe it was the memory of the delicious halibut I had there that helped to disappoint me here.  But I have vowed, never again will I go to Scoma's, I don't care who's in town.

HB0OEby4sXYE8hUqYY5Blw.review_text: Maybe should be a four star! I had many recommendations on this one. So I came with certain expectation, but was only disappointed.  The food here is good, not great! I gave 3 stars because it is too pricy! It sits along the water, view is very enjoyable!

HhrqUcGEPej2tp95zZWtdA.review_text: Last time I was here was about 10 years ago.  I had a great dinner meal then.  Today, I was nothing but largely disappointed!  I ordered the crab cakes, which were nothing but filler; the calamari, just crunchy batter; and it's been 40 minutes since we ordered our entrees and they still haven't been served.  10 years ago, I remembered having the best choppino in my life!  The prices haven't changed, but the food has gone done the tubes!  I won't be back.  Our server was great!  But, the bartender and hostess were another story.  Perhaps there's a romance between the two.  Don't care, not supposed to be apart of the dinning experience.  I will never come back!

-dZ3dAtWdo1wodvZ094LBw.review_text: Superb.  Took my mom here for her birthday, and even came here for mine.  Fixe Price Lunch is always great. Seafood is extremely fresh. The dishes themselves have always been prepared well.  Staff is friendly and professional.  The only knock I gave from the five stars it should have is the price. Otherwise, I'd come again anytime I could

eDJ0TW7kNxkyGt_O7sN8VA.review_text: Came here with my GF and her fam for her bday and I must say, the food was amazing.  Everything from their Pasta, to the Clam Chowder (which was my favorite, sooo freshhh), to the strawberry cheesecake (destroys cheesecake factory!), the food is basically to die for.  But the only gripe i got is that the price will kill u too haha.  The average $$ for a plate here in Scoma's is around $25.  Our total bill easily ran up $275+  for just 5 people.  That scared me.  Luckily I didnt have to pay! (though i did offer).  :X  PS:  It can be a bit intimidating going here as most of the customers were decked out in nice clothes.. I felt as though they were staring at my attire the whole time.. boo

kFI_0eRgjJvV0a1RkRQ4oA.review_text: My parents took my husband and me here for dinner last weekend, and we all had a fantastic experience. The service was amazing. Our server was the most charming gentleman -- I wish I could remember his name and give him credit here. He knew the menu inside out and gave very informed opinions on various dishes. To his credit I ordered the broiled halibut, which was the best fish I've ever had. It was light, flakey, and didn't taste fishy at all! We left the restaurant fat & happy!

KVMWBDfZO9eySXxlv4xrZg.review_text: Whole roasted dungeness crab.  That's all you need to know.  Fresh, garlic, butter, lemon........I wish I had two of them right now!  If only it wasn't 2,500 miles away.....This place has old school class, too.  From the interior to the waiters themselves, this is how fine dining should be.

hN03Wim4nDQ-824277aEsQ.review_text: Very nice, upscale, though tourist packed seafood restaurant close enough to fisherman's wharf for convenience, but off the beaten path enough to be classy. Though they are on the water, there didn't appear to be an outdoor seating area so the view tends to be more of the restaurant itself and the small marina than the bay itself. When you enter, it really appears that Scoma's will be outrageously expensive from the decor and waitstaff's outfits, but it is really quite reasonable, especially compared to the tourist traps nearby. We visited, hoping mostly for a gorgeous bay view, and were disappointed in that regard, but very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. The view is fine, but not stunning as we had hoped. After sitting, I was afraid it would be classic, "old people" food, but it really turned out to be quite unique with an inspired menu of classic seafood dishes and some new spins on them as well. We had the crab louie salad, which was mush less what you would think of as crab salad, and more of an actual salad covered in huge mounds of tender local crab, as well as the crab spoonbread which was like a delectable shepherd's pie of crab. I'm so glad we both got crab as it was absolutely incredible there. You could tell it was amazingly fresh, probably off the boat that morning. All in all, it was a great place to eat. Though probably 90% of their clientele are tourists, they manage to make it feel like your are one of their regulars.

ze51OKsl5vlg5Cx4D6YCQQ.review_text: Among my two favorite seafood restaurants in SF, with a fabulous Bloody Mary. Would have rated five stars, but the service has been off-and-on for at least the past year. Also, their previous menu was better. If you get a good server, they are happy to let you order off menu, however. Scoma's is the only seafood restaurant on the Wharf that passes muster and still a great place for parties or to take your out of town guests.

xtPt_hu5i65AxZv7k3eM_w.review_text: Best Seafood restaurant hands-down in the world.  Been coming here since I was a kid.  They are located on a pier, and own their own fishing boats.  There is a fish processing building on the pier where the boats drop off the fish on their way to the kitchen on their way to your plate.  What else can I say?  The Bread the bring you is incredible.  The Calimari melts in your mouth.  The crab Louis is huge, the locally caught Sand Dabs are great, The Crab Sandwich, I could go on and on.  If you are looking for Seafood that you wont ever forget, Scoma's is it.  If your visiting the city from somewhere not near the ocean, you need to go to scoma's.  Just FYI, i get the Lazy Man's Cippino- its insane.  They will Valet park your car for free on the pier, just drive back there.  They are located on Al Scoma way at the end of an alley off fishermans wharf.

5LZ-5Y-0A4eAbzVcT1KmqA.review_text: My stomach does not lie. The Halibut at Scoma's was unique, and it picked up momentum with each and every bite. The "Lazy Man's" Cioppino looked so good at the neighboring table as two creative businessmen discussed the newest innovations, and I thought about grabbing a spoon to try their food. My kids were quite happy with the Lobster Ravioli, and they wasted no time in selecting that dish...kids seem to know...what is it ...texting or a quick nod. We all tried the soups - Lobster Bisque and Scoma's Famous Clam Chowder - it delivered a smile. So we missed trying the sides like Sauteed Mushroom and Creamed Spinach, but that is what you get for drinking the wine too fast... for sure next time. This is where experience kicks in, like knowing to drive up in front for free parking...missed that too. Wine was outstanding, at the suggestion of a noteworthy waiter - Tony. This is a good spot to view the Bay, and the bar looked inviting with a great bay view. Recommended number one restaurant for entertaining at the Fisherman's Wharf. Reservation turned out to be a good idea. Now I am hungry again.

A7JhhoAPMuY9sA8yRho4tg.review_text: After hearing about this place since the last time my boyfriend and I were in the bay, we have been wanting to come here for months now! We finally were able to make the trip here this weekend for my our 4 year anniversary. Hehe. :) We came here for lunch after an Alcatraz tour. I like how the restaurant is located away from all the craziness on Jefferson St. Makes the dining experience a bit more relaxing.   My boyfriend ordered the cracked whole Dungeness crab, clam chowder and a Cesar salad. I ordered the lobster ravioli. Lobster ravioli was delicious. Even though there were only about 7 pieces of ravioli, they were about twice the size of other raviolis at other restaurants. It was creamy, not too heavy and even came with a piece of the lobster tail. At first, I thought it was just for decorations, but the tail still had delicious and fresh meat attached to it. The clam chowder and Cesar salad were also very delicious and flavorful. Definitely not your usual soup and salad that tastes like it was just thrown together with not much effort in making it different. I wish I had good taste buds to be able to pick out what made it different. But just know that I think you won't be disappointed! I think the best part of this meal though, is the crab! It was a good size crab, served chilled and had so much meat in it! It seemed like my boyfriend kept pulling good size pieces of meat out of each leg. I love crab and have always had it at Chinese restaurants. Those crabs don't compare to this one! Didn't even need to add any sauces or lemons.   Service was also great. Very attentive, friendly and quick, but we did eat at a slower time. However, I definitely will come here again the next time I'm in town. Nothing like eating fresh seafood at the pier in San Francisco. :)

4pycaclT4sJi3ylXV9hoqw.review_text: This review makes up for all the years in the past before Yelp was invented...  Consistently delicious! Wild King Salmon , fish & chips were delicious!  Service always welcoming & tentative. Great for lunch & dinner. Reservations recommended.

_aqB4nj2hnRmWM56tAmS2Q.review_text: Really good seafood. Nice service. Had a lot of fun.

GY2H5zsOs8AlFidWidw3Gg.review_text: This place surprised me. A bit old fashioned but good food and 5 star service. Especially when you consider a lot of the other mediocre places around the area.

d9mSbe_sbWVlnaGtlylmfQ.review_text: Do you see all these good reviews? I splurged all the way that night.   Walked in on a Thursday night with no reservations. Prolly about 7:30pm.
