Overall, the service was awesome!  I gave this place an extra star because of how GREAT their clam chowder was.  I'd go back here again for their clam chowder, and try something different; maybe their Prix Fixe dinner before 5PM.

BBcwOf_YVO4mk5MKZEJbRw.review_text: I love a fancy restaurant where you can show up in jeans and t-shirt and nobody blinks an eye.  Expensive, but the service is superb, the food is delicious (the best sea food I've ever had), and my wife's cioppino was big enough to take a bath in.  Truly excellent place to eat!

Elr7_s3ySqU3hfJCsY705w.review_text: You know you've stepped into the right place when half the people in the restaurant are sitting with bibs on. We stopped by for lunch and enjoyed everything we had.   For an appetizer, we had the fried calamari which had an impossibly light and crispy batter. For our entrees, we selected from the price fix menu which is an incredible deal for $23 with a soup/salad, entree and dessert. We selected 3 different dishes - the swordfish, the NY steak, and a seafood pasta. The swordfish and the steak were both incredibly tender and flavorful, and while the pasta was not spectacular, it was still good.  Service was wonderfully attentive and friendly. Will definitely come back.

YXoH0u35PsSRDQniR45Qww.review_text: Took my friend here for a birthday and it was all the good things I remembered. The bar has excellent bloody marys the house wines are good too. I had the funniest waiter with his old school shtick that made our evening. Best meal I have had in a long time. Best seafood restaurant for me in San  Francisco.

7CsQfZGaIBM4Xb3Xn0ShAw.review_text: The food is good, and view was oddly just okay.  It was of the dock and close up, docks are dirty and the windows were dirty too (I'm not knocking them for that - they're on the ocean!).  Three stars for our food & server!  Our server was faaaaaabulous~, they give large portions, wonderful bread & butter (that my family and I are so good at eating before dinner rolls out).  Be careful when you order the ciopinno!  It's huge (could feed 3-4)!!  This place is a good spot for tourists.  She found a pearl in her oyster.  FTW.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: Touristy, expensive, and not that good at all.  I wasted $50 here.

nUV-SU0iHIxj-RX_g-qJJw.review_text: Originally we wanted to go to crab house, since I had been there three times and I think it was a safe choice. But as I always want to try new places, we decided to try Scoma's instead.  We waited in line with 2 beers. After 40 min, we got our seats. Though checked reviews on FB, we had cravings for crab, so we ordered Dungeness crab with garlic seasoning. It was very light, so the good point is that I can taste the real taste of the crab. On the other hand, I was expecting the taste of something similar to the crab house ( crispy and crunchy !!!)  Anyways, the fried oyster with wasabi is fantastic! it is a must try I would say. I guess next time, I had better just follow what other reviewers on yelp recommended  ( pasta, lobster, and lamb) instead of the crab :)

HSz-e89-hr-g0Z4qgfOskA.review_text: On the water. A little too pricey.   Clam chowder- good  Dungenous crab- good  Chocolate fudge tort- fabulous

pGxFfQCjd90hCJYp85MT7Q.review_text: I think they were going for a theme here... Like an old 70's sports tavern on the docks??   I was there for a 14 person dinner party that included an 87 year old grandmother, and a paralized cousin in a wheel chair.   Sure, the food sucks (hence the 2 stars) but they also had the amazing idea of moving us too and from to accomodate a bridal shower party! When I complained to the manager (nicely) she was defensive and rude, spouting "I'm not the one who told you that you could be seated in this area".  Sup wit that!  Anyways, the fetteccini was crappier than a $3 Lean Quisine and the other dinners I tried (NY steak, and  shrimp pasta) were average at best!  With so many places to eat at in San Francisco don't waste your time, money, and daily caloric intake on this place. I'm just sayin...

Q_Pgb-t6clsURXQI1fQM0w.review_text: We had a large group, service and food was amazing!!! Crab cakes we delicious, lobster bisque was fantastic!! I had the Dungeness crab legs which was was huge portion that was prepared perfectly.

A5Ss7ycTDSqAG43PQrBGyg.review_text: This place ooozes bay area class and charm.  I felt at peace and cozy here.  The bartender is friendly and the wine list is straight from California gold.  I felt that the bar menu was too expensive.  17-22$ for bar food??? I think not.  Better off hitting up the local street stands if you are just looking for a quick bite.  Definitely stop by to ogle the nice views and drink some nice drinks.  But be prepared to shell out the cash.

CzAQw3BTHWYhSNboBOkVnA.review_text: Excellent service and quality food. Their cioppino is pricey ($39) however the best I've had. Great fresh sourdough bread. Very busy and after 5pm usually a long wait so best to.make a reservation.

H13Q7JVk6-gk7_9HCzLKnw.review_text: Really tasty seafood salad (along with other dishes) and valet parking makes this place a must-visit eatery! Check it out next time you're in SF!

AwWWxN2E77o0udcdpvYyNA.review_text: Always one of my favorite San Francisco Old School places to eat. The dishes are all great. Great Calamari, Great Crab Louie, Great hug fish dishes and the lobster bisque OMG. Always hits the spot if you are craving REAL FRESH right out of the sea dishes.

h4o8e_Xbca2kXQO_vzOqgg.review_text: Excellent time here at Scoma's!! I came for lunch and our timing was perfect because they had dine about town deals. So we got a 2 course meal for $17.95!! We were seated right by the window with a beautiful view of the boats and the water. yelp.com/user_local_phot… The service here is nice, our server was so genuine and knew a lot about seafood. He was polite and kind. So rare now a days. I ordered the clam chowder and the petite dungeness crab Louie salad. The Clam Chowder = 4 stars = TASTEY! yelp.com/user_local_phot… The petite CRAB Louie Salad = 5 stars = fresh ingredients, tons of crab for being "petite", best salad I've had for awhile. I'll definitely be eating more greens if all my salads tasted this good. yelp.com/user_local_phot… Oh and dessert was tiramisu with a whole chocolate spoon! Beautiful presentation. yelp.com/user_local_phot… I love the history behind Scoma's, I loved the service and the food. Full on 5 stars for me. Nothing bad to say on my visit.

c1WLD1pCHsNlTqm29oZ8Vw.review_text: Really enjoyed the seafood.  Located right on the wharf.  Hop on a tour of the bay and then grab dinner at Scoma's.

hXSYiApbVJPjqRJEF-yloQ.review_text: As I'm reading the dismal reviews left by some of the others I'm shocked!!   Now before they had opentable (so thankful they do now) yes the waits were ridiculous as you had to walk in, no reservations before... But this place is so worth it!! Now most people have a smart phone or cell phone for that matter, so there's no excuse not to call ahead...   Food reviews... I've NEVER ever had a bad dish here... From the scallops, fettuccini, smoked salmon, lobster bisque, clam chowder, seafood sautée, tiramisu, their cocktails, lobster raviolis, everything has been superb... We drive and hour or so here just to eat!!   This is the best seafood in the Bay Area!!   Ps they do have valet parking!!!

JEJjk4COmdqnDE5hQHsksQ.review_text: Scoma is a seafood-lovers dream. The menu is bursting with a variety of local fare prepared simply but full of flavor.  My boyfriend ordered the lobster bisque and was thoroughly surprised by how delicious it was (coming from the east coast he was skeptical). He said it had the perfect balance of cream and lobster. He also ordered his first Dungeness crab and loved it. It comes with a side of either regular melted butter or garlic butter and he said the garlic butter was definitely the way to go.  If you aren't a seafood eater there are few options for you so i would suggest going elsewhere. They do seafood exceptionally well and that's definitely what you should come for.  As far as ambiance it seems to be on the fancier side though it's filled with tourists for afternoon lunch and it doesn't appear to enforce a dress code. I imagine that's different for the evenings. It's also situated back off the main drag basically in the marina which makes for some wonderful views and a quieter atmosphere.

lH3m71g_Eqor0NdtGaMwoA.review_text: Scoma was delicious. I went there on a Sunday night with my dad and grandparents and we were seated within 10 minutes, pretty amazing if you ask me. Our table had a pretty decent view too!  We ordered the Crab Louie Salad, which came with a mountain of crab. And when I say a mountain, it was like the Mt. Everest of mountains. It was probably one of the best Crab Louie Salads I have ever had. We also ordered a mixed seafood saute, which was also incredible. It came with some rice and steamed veggies, and just delicious. The best part about Scoma's was how perfectly all the seafood was cooked - especially the scallops!  There was so much food that the 4 of us had some heavy to-go boxes and I had an amazing lunch and dinner the following day. I'm not easily impressed by seafood restaurants but Scoma's definitely gets my stamp of approval.  Major plus -- free valet :)

ESrzDFy58BXa_ZOsa41yVg.review_text: Every single time I've eaten at Stevens Steak House, it has been a truly amazing experience! I love their steaks and seafood! The Latin dancing and atmosphere after-hours is also outstanding! The #1 Salsa and Bachata nightclub in CA for sure. Sunday nights are the best!

mFM9e6geCc0_nX7QqMnpYQ.review_text: I've heard about this place. I wanted to go to this place. I actually dreamed of this place. I concocted a master plan for how I would get to go to this place.   I busted an inception months prior to my birthday and planted the idea in my BF's brain to take me to Scoma's. We had a fab time, just us two. The food was ridiculously overpriced what I call "TP" = tourist prices. What else would you expect when dining in SF on one of the piers?   We had the komamoto oysters...delish, calamari fritti calabrese....yummy goodness.   I had the petit fillet mignon with colossal jumbo prawns...the steak so tasty and succulent...perfectly cooked; the prawns...well, the two biggest damn prawns I've ever seen on my plate.   He had the broiled salmon over crab raviolis...so creamy and delightful!   Although it was busy, the service was great and our waiter was pretty comedic.  I'd definitely go again to try other entrees and especially the cioppino...but it better be a special occasion.  One negative, where are the jacket/purse hooks at the bar?

Nw2CWSef8zlpc79XMLlRjA.review_text: Best fresh seafood in the Wharf.  Scoma's "lazy man's" cippino ($39) is large enough for two and still leaves some to take home. We ask for Bruce-best waiter.

60hQMvFWiZn8qEvQZKRahg.review_text: The food alone was worth 4 stars, but I had to knock off two star for the service.   We had ordered during out visit a bowl of lazy man's cioppino, a bowl of clam chowder and a salmon crab cake sandwich. The cioppino was very good as was the clam chowder. The sandwich was decent as well.   I do not know if it was because we were a young couple that did not want to indulge in a bottle of wine with our lunch, or if we appeared as if we did not bleed money. Our waiter greeted us fine at first, but for the rest of the meal acted very rude and reluctant to provide any service.   I definitely do not appreciate have spoons tossed at us.   As good as the food was, I feel hesitant to go back for a second visit. I expect kind and courteous service when eating at a nice restaurant like Scoma. The service provided made us feel like we did not deserve being there because we did not appear wealthy. We were there ready to pay for a good meal and a pleasant experience, please do not treat your customers like they cannot afford the meal just cause they do not appear filthy rich.

bhJ6ivAuSpgXP4JiKWjSZQ.review_text: Expensive!  Wasn't as easy to find as I thought it would be.  Small restaurant.  Nice ambiance.  Our waiter was a little arrogant.  Good bread.  Son ordered lobster tail.  The market value was $54!  Husband had salmon and enjoyed it.  I had the vegetable risotto. It was good but nothing I would order again.

iCYiQLmnGriuxbpN_MWq6Q.review_text: TRIPLE YUMMILISCIOUS!!! Very Romantic Dinner with Scot ... Lobster and Salmon were wonderful and the service was AMAZING! The view from the table was GREAT near the San Francisco Bay with the moonlight shining down upon the calm waters. You can also dress up although it is not required and they have a coat check in area too! LOVE SCOMA'S in Beautiful San Francisco! Posting pics of the food , drinks and location!

t9kqIhAIJmoC36ch6G-6Eg.review_text: We had a 7:00 p.m. reservation, but we were not seated until 7:40 p.m. That said, the bar staff was wonderful and we enjoyed the time that we were waiting. The food was excellent and the service was top-notch.

zXi8WzXV2lfefnnzPEnOOw.review_text: Love this spot, always have...but I am still waiting for them to serve drawn butter instead of that clarified shit.  It's like pouring vegetable oil on your damn food!    But the last time I had the seafood extravaganza...and no that is not the real name of it but it is a plate of scallops, crab, baby lobsters, prawns all over a bed of rice and veggies.  Freaking amazing.   The lobster bisque is pretty amazing as well.    Our server was pretty damn funny and was all over us with good service and great recommendations.   Homeboy takes his dish description seriously.  It was like he had a monologue prepared for a casting call, I gave him a standing O when he finished his spiel.     I have yet to have any dessert here though as I am usually stuffed to a point of discomfort.

EWPk6-PeaOt2k6GcJ0JKjg.review_text: Scoma was recommended by a friend who had lived in SF many years ago and this place used to be her favourite restaurant, frequented by a lot of locals.   From my experience, I dont think that holds true anymore. Like myself, I saw a lot of tourist/ out-of-town patrons....well, there is nothing wrong with that but with that said, it is disappointing to see people walking into such high end restaurant in football jersey or jeans. I almost felt overdressed!  Food was delicious. The clam chowder is one of the best I've  ever had ($9 a bowl, it bettter be!) and for my main, my grilled prawns was really good and cooked to perfection (love the slight burnt grill taste)...the sides that came with my main were vegetables and some sort of wild rice (love it!)...very buttery.  From reading other reviews, it looks like Scoma's standard has dropped throughout the years. But from a first timer's experience, I enjoyed my meal tremendously and would definitely recommend to others.

INMM1Q_4qGMIbxwb4IUbLQ.review_text: I always order the Lazy man's cioppino when I come here. Has lots of seafood and good enough for two people.

Ar9712ERlUsC69ycLnXaSQ.review_text: I love to cook and one of my favorite dishes to make is Chipino.  A very tasty and hearty fish/and shellfish/crab stew which is even more enjoyable with good garlic bread.  I have made this dish many times and for large parties.   I also love to order this dish when I go to a good seafood restaurant.  Having said this, I must say, the lazy man' Chipino with Garlic bread at Scoma's was by far the best, I have had at any restaurant and I hate to say it was better than my own.   The dish is packed with seafood.  The tomatoe base is awsome!, and the fish was very fresh and the garlic bread was unreal!!-   It hit levels of pure gluttony that my brother and I both ordered our own bowl which was just ridiculous.  If on a date you could definitely share this dish for two.

XnKUcmayZd-N43fR2n-0Ew.review_text: Best Crab meal I have ever had. Well trained professional and mature wait staff was very nice. The sourdough was sublime, and the wine was aplenty. That all makes for one memorable night out in San Francisco, and Scoma's delivered on a an enjoyable Fisherman's Warf Dinner out. I am old school seafood and cut my teeth at The Rusty Pelican, putting in almost a decade as a manger, so I know quality when I see it. The only reason the place got less then 5 stars was it needs a face lift and a good dusting. The hostess stand is antiquated and needs to be changed. The hostess stand is almost like a betting window at an old race track, only less welcoming, and the rest of the place, except the dining room seemed dingy.  Would I recommend Scoma's? HECK YES!!!! plan on a wait but there is a bar!

OVePUY8f_l6fj-7-roweTw.review_text: Went twice while i was in town for 3 days. Just go you will not be disappointed!! Great food great service!

ZM1bouHR6IvPTUQLvtQVCQ.review_text: One of the best dinners I've ever had. Simply amazing! Our server was so nice. He left us alone when appropriate and was there when we needed him. Love the atmosphere of this place. Go!!

g7lWRSezAOrPz8Xcjnpd8A.review_text: If white rice and pasta side by side on a plate is your idea of a good start for a $36 entree, or even makes sense to you, then Scoma's may be your place.  Such was the foundation of the excessively butter soaked shellfish saute.  Vegetables were an unimaginative brocco-cauli-zuch-carrot blend.  I had the lazy man's cioppino, which was abundant with swordfish, crab, shrimp, as well as some scallops and clams.  However, I found the clams exceptionally gritty and the tomato base too thick and sweet for my liking (think Campbells or ketchup.)  The volume level was high, with clientele speaking loudly at tables and on cell phones.  The wait for a table for two on a Tuesday night was about an hour.  Reservations are not accepted.  While our small table had a nice view of Coit Tower and the Transamerica building, it was quite cold sitting next to the window.  The free valet parking is very convenient.  However, the car came back smelling like cigarettes.

VIEK34UOVmyzmnJtwv8ByA.review_text: I agree that this place is a hidden gem in SF's Fishermans Wharf. It has great food with a nice view of the bay and the yachts (depends on where you are seated).   My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday celebration last month, he knows that I love seafood so much and I don't like to go anywhere fancy. This place passed all my expectations! They serve the best seafood in Fisherman's Wharf although very pricey. I didn't know what to order because there are so many selections to choose from. But our server recommended the food that I had. I forgot what it's called but it has lobster, crab, scallops  , shrimps, pasta and rice in it. I was first hesitant to order what the server suggested because I always know what to get and I'm not quite use to being told what to get. But soon as they serve my food, it smelled great and it tasted great! The portion was really big too! After that, they serve me a surprise birthday chocolate cake (on the house), I love how it's not too sweet, just perfect!   I want to talk about our server really quick, he is very nice and funny because he sang me the happy birthday song even it was just by himself singing. Lol Thank you, server!  The ambiance of the place is OK, it's dated and there are more oldies than young people. It's casual attire and the place is not too loud. If you want to go to this place, make sure you have a RESERVATION!  Highly recommend and I would definitely go back again! :)

RzhLXQmzjuhxPPka6jw6rQ.review_text: Okay service, but not great....food was barely edible, too full of butter & sauce, used many techniques to hide the foods true taste...merely a place that has made it into a tour guide for inland based tourists.

1ziPC7yx27Ps_m0MzN2OxQ.review_text: I know I have been here before.  At least, the place seemed really familiar when I walked in for lunch today.  My friends from out of town have been praising the cioppino here for months, so when they finally were able to come to SF, we of course had to go to get the cioppino at Scoma's.  I guess I expected a lot from here considering it's one of the landmarks of SF/Fisherman's Wharf, so when the wait person forgot that one of the guest's appetizers and didn't bring it until the other two of us finished ours... -1 point.  One of us ordered clams on the half shell.  Super fresh, super big clams.  YUM!!! But, they weren't shucked at all... So, I got to watch one of my friends pry the suckers off of their scallops (those things that connect them to the shells) with his little fork.  Funny, but also not the norm, even at the most basic raw bar.  - another point.  However, the cioppino was delicious!  I am not sure if it was really $30 worth of deliciousness, considering a lot of it was filler (bay shrimps).  But the flavor was great and the portions big.  My girlfriend and I shared one and a salad and we were not able to finish.  I saw that the twin lobster tails was a whopping $80... I will steam my own at that price any day.  So, all in all, a good classic restaurant with some potential for hiccups and very expensive prices.  3 stars for not meeting my high expectations of the place.

MGxejEL_1FkQF9irC2Sjjg.review_text: After 35 years living the Bay Area, I know well enough that you don't go to the Wharf or Pier 39 looking for good food - it's just an overpriced tourist trap.  Nonetheless, every once in awhile I throw caution to the wind and eat there anyway.  Or some damned tourist friend from out of town drags me there.  Scoma's is the best of the lot, though the lot ain't good.  It'd be 3 or even 3.5 starworthy if it weren't so overpriced - by about 2x.  The service was very good and the view was cool.  But the food wasn't so good that I can remember what I had; but not so bad I can remember either.  All I remember is that it was really overpriced.  But, if I were a bettin' man, I'd bet is was fish.  Most likely.

OSU8q3vkb8t6IXac4y9vHw.review_text: I give a 3.5 stars.   One star for the awesome staff and service. Our waitress Lilian was friendly and attentive.   One more star for their fried calamari. Best fried calamari I have had. And another 1.5 star for the trio appetizer the boyfriend and I had ordered.   As for my plate, the Sand Dab, it is usually a great tasting fish but what came with my fish was boiled Pennae pasta and over cooked asparagus. The sand dab did not have the garlic caper flavored sauce that the fish was to be cook in. Instead, it tasted like a light white fish in batter. I would call my sand dab, fancy fish filets or fish sticks. As for the Pennae it had no flavor. When I say boiled that's it. It was dry and had no seasoning. And as for my asparagus it was too mushy and soft. Not worth $30. I wish I ordered something else.   And I did not want to hurt my boyfriend's feelings cause he raved about this place being awesome, and that he wanted to take me here to try it out. So thanks to him, but I guess I wouldn't order the sand dab again. At least not here.   But overall, I will come back one more time in hopes I order something better and not be a disappointment.

OLTUhNOaZ8dE9FIvYg8R6g.review_text: Great seafood and good customer service.

cFXstS2beDCqIEN9do2Leg.review_text: On a visit to SF, we stopped here for brunch.  I actually can not say that I enjoyed the place.    Our meals were nothing special....perhaps because we ordered shrimp and crab sandwiches rather than a main entrée??  Our server was weird and so was predominately senior citizen aged crowd.  I think it is over-hyped and over-priced.

ZpUI9ze0YlA6nMSHwx3ZYQ.review_text: Used my Yelp app on my Android phone in the Fisherman's Wharf area and found Scoma's. Scoma's was a little hard to find from the main Fisherman's Wharf area as one needs to walk down an alley towards the Pier 47 before finding the main entrance at the back of the restaurant.  The interior is upscale, classy, and dated. The host was in a full suit and the wait staff were all in white tuxedos. Our request for a table with a view was honored.   Our meal started off with bread which was the worst part of our meal. The bread was cold and stale. ...the butter was also cold and didn't even start to melt on the cold bread...  The appetizer sampler was out of this world! At $26, there was plenty of fried calamari which was super fresh, perfectly cooked (not rubbery) and lightly battered. The crab cakes were melt-in-your-mouth good and the shrimp scampi was delicious too! :D  The Lazy Man's Cioppino that our waiter and Yelpers raved about was over-rated and over-priced at $36. The seafood stew was okay. The best part was probably the garlic bread that was dipped into the marinara sauce.   Service was friendly by our waiter. He even brought and tied a bib around our neck, which was definitely a nice touch! :)

jfpL7iZ79fMSP3sodkjLfA.review_text: Very good food with service that was quite good. The waiter was more than happy to banter with us while we ordered and while checking in on our meal.   The only major critique I have was that it took a longer time to order than it should have. It was busy, but not to the point of slowing down the kitchen or waitstaff.   Overall I recommend to anyone seeking an Italian seafood restaurant.

l-ECea3knk6W_euS6-dSag.review_text: Guests Vising Town = Dining Request = Seafood = where else would you go = Fisherman's Wharf.  And where else to find a place to dine but Yelp!  We chose Scoma's.  Even though they don't take reservations and we were going to head down around 7:30, and new it would be a madhouse (which it was), we put in our name for a 45 minute wait and walked around a bit, had a drink.  We showed up after 40 minutes and were seated after waiting an additional 5.  Not Bad!  Bread was of course great.  Wine was flowing.  Appetizers of Calamari and Tuna were good.  Calamari was a bit tough, so I was wondering how long it had been frozen.  Tuna was fantastic.  One companion had swordfish and you could tell by the way she was laid back in her chair, grin on her face, and fork going at lightening speed she was a happy camper.  Two of us got the lazy man's cioppino, and it was full of amazing, well cooked fish (and at 1/2 pound of Crab, very satisfying).  The tomato broth was very rich - so not for the timid if you can't handle rich food.  The fourth diner had steak and jumbo prawns and again, huge smile on the face.  For dessert, had the strawberries and cream along with the Pecan Torte.  Both were great.  So if you are looking for a crowd pleaser and don't mind a wait, Scoma's is definitely a place to check out.

0rz1q0JfGN7kDFEw4LSI4A.review_text: $72 lunch that sucked. No drinks just water. You have got to be nuts to spend this kind of money for something that just tastes like a $10 meal. Never again. Save it for the tourists with lots of money.

Lvu0088gU2xYKjyfzLA26g.review_text: We were recommended to check out this place from my sister. Wow- great food and service! The garlic Dungeness crab rocked!! Totally would come back and recommend this place! Cocktails were yummy! Great and attentive service from the staff. :)

7mXrlHTcWT_g8Z6BWVZgKw.review_text: The first time I ate here was on a visit with my parents when I was a teenager. Loved it then and I've visited a number of times over the years when in the area on business. This time I was in SF on vacation with my family and we walked over for lunch. This place is lovely with great service and such a lovely old school feel. The atmosphere is a cut above some of the other restaurants in the area and the food is outstanding. Even the kids loved it. Great service, view and food. I always leave thinking of when I might manage to squeeze in another visit.

teAEfr_kJCkSq44xokpgnw.review_text: Group diners, I recommend you go somewhere else. The seating hostess was not accommodating at all to our group. Her manner was completely off-putting, her tone was cold, and her handling of the situation ranked in my top ten of worst customer service experiences ever.   There are restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf that will treat your group like valued customers. I know because we have experienced some of them. Scoma's not one of them, or at least it wasn't for us.   I should say that our waiters were good though. So I don't want this review to reflect negatively on them at all.

vPdMeQRyVBNGw24pr5PIng.review_text: We wanted to get some fresh seafood around the wharf without the tourist trap atmosphere.... and found what we were looking for with Scoma's.   Short wait and we were seated at a window table overlooking the docks. This was great since our 6yr old had something interesting to view... as well as us. The waiter was outstanding from the first greeting and gave my son some crayons and paper to keep him busy.  The menu is packed with all the favorites from Crab Luis to a variety of Risottos so it took some time for my wife to pick but I saw Cioppino right from the start and knew I must have it. She ordered a Scallop dish. The staff was VERY helpful with pointing out house specialties and favorites.  For starters we shared a plate of Oysters and Lobster Bisque. Both were excellent and the table bread was fresh and warm Boudin Sourdough.  As we finished the appetizers, we saw a huge bowl of large mussels delivered to the table next to us and my wife was bummed she didnt see that before she ordered . The waiter over heard  and said he would switch the order if she liked.   Great decision because those mussels were excellent. The Cioppino, well all I can say is top notch! I have been searching for the perfect bowl and found it. Tons of seafood in there, bay shrimp, prawns, scallops, clams, fish, and Dungeness Crab chunks. The broth was perfect as well.  For now on, every stop in San Fran will be a new ritual meal at Scoma's. Outstanding fresh food with the service to match. I read a lot of complaints of the prices but I feel you get (or exceed for that matter) what you pay for. Cant wait to get back.

9k_0LFDqEmBOdc-QfCWwrg.review_text: In the heart of all things tacky & tourist there is a hidden gem called Scoma's. If you can stand to close your eyes, plug your nose, and plow through the souvenir shops and chain restaurants, you will find yourself on a private hidden dock facing one of the best restaurants in the city.   Put your name in (they don't take reservations) and then order a cocktail to drink in their charming bar area while looking out at the beautiful sailboats at sunset. Head next to your table for dinner where you will meet your tuxedoed and bow-tied waiter (always friendly) who will take your order. Order the following: lobster bisque & half crab- oven baked, garlicky, and ridiculously messy. You will leave full, happy, and possessing restored faith in the formerly shunned area of Fisherman's Wharf.   Bonus: If you bring 2 bottles of wine from home to enjoy, the corking fee is waived.

fitXjNnwVB_HzqaBSrIGXQ.review_text: Excellent old school seafood restaurant. This place isn't fancy (save for the classy white dinner jackets of the waiters) but it is pricey. It's definitely worth experiencing at least once since it's such an institution. The wait on a Saturday can be easily a hour or more without a reservation.  From the time you walk in until you walk out, you are greeted from friendly hostesses and waiters. The waiters are funny and know the right amount of attention to give you.  The shrimp cocktail starter is a bit pricey for what you get but it's solid and on par with the value at any other place that has something like it on the menu. The clam chowder is EXCELLENT and I recommend splitting a bowl for two if you are thinking of each getting a cup (they just give you 2 cups worth in a bowl for $2 more). There's a lot of clams in the chowder. This place overall gives big portions though you're paying for it.  The ciopinno is excellent though it's more about the parts than the whole. The broth is almost a tomato bisque and it is filled beautifully with large pieces of seafood excellently cooked. It's less about the stew mixed together like other places in North Beach.  The whole garlic roasted dungeness crab is amazing. It's generous size and well cut up and prepared.   Definitely worth trying once. I spotted the large size crab louie salad and was blown away by the sheer size of seafood -- must try it next time.

qe9vn38gBVeHdEYPYxMUiw.review_text: Lived in the Bay Area my whole life and in the City itself for the last 3 years and had never been to Scoma's before last night. The food and ambiance were both very good but I have to say that what stood out was the service.   Our table wasn't quite ready when we arrived so we had a drink at the bar and spoke with Gige for a while. She told us a little about Scoma's history and took some time to go over the menu with us and show us some of her favorites as well as describing different dishes. She was so warm and nice and was everything you'd want a bartender to be in a classic old time San Francisco institution.   Our waiter Sonny was also incredibly nice and attentive. We were interested in hearing about the specials and he described them all in detail and said he HIGHLY recommended the halibut. We trusted him and it paid off big time - the halibut was absolutely fantastic and we wouldn't have gotten it without Sonny's suggestion.   My only criticism - and reason for my 4 stars instead of 5 - has to do with the way the menu was written. I had my heart set on the crab risotto and ordered it. When it arrived it it was filled with peas and mushrooms in addition to the crab. I don't like peas or mushrooms. And my issue is that it didn't say it was made with peas and mushrooms on the menu. I picked around as much as I could and it was very good. But it would have been great had I had some way of knowing to ask for no peas or mushrooms. Also had the clam chowder which was really great.

xR4engcg6Vm8xToBgKI5FA.review_text: The perfect classic seafood restaurant on the water. Fresh, delicious food that is beautifully prepared and served with friendly, classy flair. Everything we ate was fresh, simple and delicious. We'll definitely be back!  The atmosphere of wood paneling, old photos of Scoma's fans, white napkins and sharply dressed waiters is a perfect complement to the delicious cuisine. Our Dungeness crab appetizer was so incredibly fresh! The individual flavors of every type of seafood in the Shellfish Sautee jumped out in every bite. The bread was fresh, the butter was soft, and the dessert plate was practically licked clean.   In short, if your wallet can support a special night, this place is a great choice.

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: Scoma's is old fashioned San Francisco. According to their menu they've been open since 1965 and most of the waiters look like they've been there at least that long.  They do not take reservations, but there was no wait for a party of 6 Sunday night at 6:30. Had we been a group of 3-4, there would have been a wait, but all of the larger tables were empty. So I guess if you don't want to wait, find some friends at the bar and see if you can't come up with a bigger group.  Cocktails were very good and I thought the bread was fresh and chewy. The portions here are enormous! I ordered the pasta garibaldi (linguine with salmon, scallops and mussels) in a sundried tomato pesto and could barely eat half. The sauce did not taste anything like sundried tomato pesto - in fact I'd be willing to bet money it was tomato sauce - but it was good, so whatever.  Others at the table got cioppino, crab spoon-bread, prawns and scallop platter, lobster bisque, and the crab cocktail. Everyone had good things to say about their food.  Service was ok - our waiter seemed like he was in a rush and left the table before everyone had a chance to order drinks. Water was refilled frequently and special requests were accommodated.  The atmosphere is really nice but the tables are much too close together. This would be a bad place for secret plotting, as the table next to you will 100% hear every word that you say.   Free valet is nice, but drive VERY slowly when entering and exiting their lot as it's one lane and a blind corner.

g8LyZtXmD1bwWB0yrdvjyA.review_text: This should be a 5-star review (or at least a 4.5), but thanks to our server, it isn't.   The Hubs and I ate here on a Monday night earlier this month and we came early (6:30) since quite a few reviews mention a long wait for a table. On this particular night, there was no line outside and only a few parties inside waiting for a table. We were seated within 10 minutes. Our server arrived with menus shortly after we were seated and we chatted with her a bit. She was friendly and funny. We ordered martinis while we perused the menu. The drinks came out quickly and were perfect.   After lengthy consideration of the menu, we both ordered the Dungeness Crab Cocktail for an appetizer. For an entree, I ordered the Swordfish con Fagioli, and Hubs ordered the Broiled King Salmon and asked to substitute Swiss chard for the mashed potatoes and mixed veg that came with it.   The crab cocktails were delicious; the crabmeat was soooo fresh. The cocktail sauce was somewhat overpowering, though. Fortunately, it was underneath the crabmeat and I was able to avoid most of it. Then the entrees came out. The dish I ordered was supposed to be swordfish with white beans, Swiss chard and pancetta. For some reason, there was also a sizable blob of mashed potatoes in the bowl with everything else. Huh?? Anyway, I just ate around it. The fish was great - very fresh and perfectly cooked. The beans and chard were tasty, but a bit oversalted.   The problem with the server happened with my husband's dinner. When the entrees were set down, he was brought swordfish with the requested Swiss chard (instead of king salmon). When he brought the error to our server's attention, she said somewhat rudely (and I quote) "No, you ordered swordfish." Not 'are you sure'? Not 'oh, I'm sorry'. That surprised the hell out of me. I mean, where did that friendly, fun gal go?? When Hubs said again that he ordered the salmon, she got pretty defensive and it was only when I confirmed that yes, he did in fact order salmon and I was the only one who ordered swordfish did she relent and say she would get the correct order out as quickly as possible. I mean really?! What kind of service is that?   When his salmon finally did come out about 10 minutes later, it was delicious and perfectly cooked (thank goodness), but having to sit there with my meal and slowly eating it before it got cold and him sitting there without his food kinda put the kibosh on the dining experience for me.   By the time our server came back later regarding dessert, she seemed to have regained her customer service skills and offered us a free dessert.   Anyway, I'd eat here again. I mean, one server's off night can't ruin the place for me forever (can it?).

CQKF1ipiaHv2eu2cpZnnPA.review_text: The mussels are wonderful and like none I have ever had, I highly recommend them, along with the cioppino.  If you like Bloody Mary's, then you should try the Bloody Caesar...extra spicy.  I look forward to the next time  I'm in San Francisco.

E7rnUkLX8ajxbeUtTpBuIg.review_text: Fabulous meal. Butternut squash soup with crab was perfect. Cioppino was phenomenal. Crab ravioli was sweet and creamy. Service was excellent. I wish they took reservations. Bread pudding worth the calories. Highly recommend

APnknK5EwtWrgQvlUVF16g.review_text: We found out about Scoma's from our concierge @ the Hilton last time my family went up to San Francisco. We of course wanted some fresh seafood by the pier & out of couple options, the concierge guy seemed to like this restaurant the most!  With his warning of "there can be a long wait as they don't take reservation" we headed out asap, got in the taxi, and luckily we didn't have to wait! But it was definitely a close call of a long wait as the restaurant was already packed around 5pm.   The restaurant is literally by the ocean, on the pier & they have their own fish receiving deck which ensures freshness. Inside, you can tell that it's old & has been a popular restaurant for a long time; nothing fancy but something solid.   It took them a while to take our menu, bring out bread & wines (we were starved from the drive up), and to receive the food.  BUT WOW! It was a great meal!!! Here's what we got. Fresh oysters - My sister & I don't eat oysters but parents sure loved them! Crabs - Seafood lover mom & I got crabs and yes.....................It was AMAZING! Lots of crabs that is fat to feed my hungry stomach! Once you see the portion, you know you will pay that money all over again because it was so well priced for that portion! Flavor was great too!!! Wow!!! Definitely not your typical 'just steamed' crabs! Must try!!! Because even my sister enjoyed it quite a lot! (she doesn't like seafood) Sauteed Scallops - Sis isn't a big fan of seafood so she got this which wasn't bad but for me? I would get crabs any other day! Alaskan King Salmon - Dad got the salmon & it was FRESH! So clean & juicy! Mmm~ But again, can't beat the crabs!   Overall, yes. We would return here anytime!

sBQHJzPlQYVdwjEeqtvgrQ.review_text: Situated in the heart of San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf, Scoma's provides a romantic waterfront setting, along with a lovely selection of pasta and seafood dishes that create a fitting menu for Scoma's ambiance. The complimentary bread appetizer, as well as other appetizer choices, along with the wine selection, further makes Scoma's a great restaurant for a romantic dinner with a date or an intimate dinner with a small group of friends.  Another plus is that Scoma's provides free valet parking which is a definite benefit in the area.

QcVyc44YtXXYa0GOY8BkAA.review_text: Food very good.  Downgraded due to waiter's unwillingness (or to ask kitchen staff) to crack the crab shells for our disabled guest.  This during slow time late afternoon.  So we rotated cracking duties around table letting $200 worth of food get cold.  Could have ordered something else but we went there in part so he could have the crab.  We were disappointed.

QYEtZpr2yFTzrgws5qa8qw.review_text: Service was horrible.  15 minutes after being seated, we still had not seen a server.  It took standing up and saying "who's our waiter" to get anyone over. Ordered the lobster bisque and the  hot sampler platter.  The bisque was a salty mess with only a few lobster crumbs.  Lame!!!!  The sampler consisted of "crab cakes" which were flavorless patties with very little crab, "shrimp scampi" blah, and rubbery "calamari friti". Save yourself the time and money and don't eat here, unless you enjoy bad food at a high price.

2t-9ivd6MszB7a_kLbfHsw.review_text: Clam showder is below average and all dishes came so fast that it looked like they were pre made in the kitchen (looks & taste). Lobster Thermidor was left on the side 'cause my dad could hardly eat it. My shrimp risoto was heavy and ended in the same way.

7a4VoJ7B5gsO-XUl0lGJiA.review_text: Was recommended to us by a friend.  We liked how it is down an alley, sort of off the main path, which is full of tourists.  The restaurant is more upscale, but we were still comfortable in jeans and a sweater.  It was busy, even at 2:30 in the afternoon!  The food was very good and fresh!  Prices are a little steep, but not outrageous.  You do get a lot of food, so come hungry!

ra0Op_5h3YU44cmu0j_gng.review_text: I can't complain here. It's not their fault that I'm a veggie. There were 2 options for me on the menu, well there may have been a salad, but that's not real food. I settled for the pasta pomodoro. The serving size was quite large and there was a little too much garlic (I did not think that was possible).  On a more cheerful note: Our service was excellent. The waiter was attentive, helpful and always had a smile. I'll come back- as long as the in-laws pick up the bill (Thanks again)

LyUf_8An1sTMHybvj0NXHA.review_text: Fantastic seafood! Hate that you can't make reservations and I always feel like I'm going down a sketchy dark alley.

xFsX2ySUNCOIGfNTNYiPMw.review_text: Came here for the dine about town yesterday night with my boyfriend and we were actually celebrating our two year anniversary - yay!  I ordered the lobster bisque and I wished my portion was bigger because I really like it a lot. I was trying to save my soup as long as possible but it was difficult. I also had to share some with my boyfriend as well ! so definitely not enough. My boyfriend had the dungeness crab cakes - very yummy.   For entree, I was hoping they have the prawns with linguine like their menu on the dine about town website mentioned, but yesterday they had scallops with linguine which sounds just as good. I couldn't even finish my meal because it was quite a big portion. Very good but would like it more if there was more sauce. My boyfriend had the lamb t-bones which is really flavorful and juicy. Meat is tender and I only had one piece since I was way too full and wanted to leave a bit of room for dessert.  Dessert: I ordered the walnut brownie and triple espresso ice cream - yum yum yum. I did prefer my brownie to not have walnut but oh wells - I still love it a lot.   I actually been to this restaurant like 10 years ago with my family, but totally forgot till I was walking in the alley toward the restaurant. Our seats was not too great yesterday because we were sitting at the deepest corner ever with no window view of the water. I guess, next time!

GvEPXNU4f8SHDs0HaT0dZQ.review_text: The restaurant is tucked behind the busy street of pier 39.  They offer valet parking which is great.  My choice for food is always the seafood pasta.  It is delicious but sometimes they skimmed on the portion.  It is not always consistent.  Waiters are mostly older ladies and gentlemen.  It is not a hip place but a place for fresh seafood with family.

us6BsoAlY4adFj7FG4DGCA.review_text: Fresh, well prepared sea food.  Amazing view.  Exceptional service.  (expect a wait and bring a solid credit card)  Dungeness crabs are in season and "The Lazy Man's Cioppino" is a perfect choice.

WC4JmvZ9mst9PEDk2IQCFQ.review_text: Review for this one visit. In town for work alone and wanted to have dinner at the bar. They said they don't serve dinner at the bar but I could sit at a table alone just 8 feet away. I could order appetizers but no meals. Really?! On a Monday night with your restaurant less than half full and less in the bar area?! I moseyed on down to the next restaurant. Too bad- simply an explanation would have appeased me.

gJZutDw30Vnt7Av7IIHhOQ.review_text: Really, really good. It's a restaurant, so the food matters most, and they have that covered in spades. The seafood list is proper - not too long, but it covers the bases and reflects what's fresh and tasty. And boy is it ever. Really, go for the seafood, you'll love it. Read the rest of this if you're bored...  I liked the style of the place. Fancy, but not overly so, suggesting that food quality and service were most important, and looking overly fancy just for the sake of doing so was not - they know their food speaks for itself.  The service is good, friendly and knowledgeable. It was a bit slow when we went (my parents' last night visiting me in SF), but it was also the evening after the Nike Women's Marathon so everything everywhere was packed. (An aside: is it really necessary to wear your race number on top of your evening clothes? Do you really need me to know you ran? Isn't the satisfaction of finishing a marathon enough?)  Anyhow, really good seafood, not overly expensive, good service, and a nice out-of-the-way location so it feels like you're going to a 'secret' spot that most people who live in SF seem to know about (and love).  Oh, and try the fish, it's great.

XuJxZu_tRiPCDZFaQF-Rdw.review_text: Tried will I was in San Fran on business 2 weeks ago.  I am a seafood junkie and this was one on the highly rated restaurants so i figured Id give it a try.  I'm a taster so I tried a bit of everyone's food.  LOL  My dish was the mixed seafood grill.  Very yummy!  I was afraid for the price I was going to be disappointed by the portions- but i was surprised.  Plenty shrimp, scallops, crab, and lobster.   I sampled the blacked shrimp, grilled salmon, and fried shrimp.. All very good.    The place is sort tight on space so expect to be elbow to elbow if you have a large party with you(We had 6 and there was no room at the table to move much).  Overall I would recommend...if you have the money to spare(bring a well packed wallet)  Entrees run from about $22 minimum on up.

_WDhO6yeZQoVo5agXH3Tbw.review_text: I came to Scoma's for Dine Around Town, and the food was so delicious!!  Me and my boyfriend came here with a friend for lunch, and we were seated immediately.  I was a bit surprised, since all the yelp reviews stated that they get busy and the wait can be long.  I guess I beat the lunch rush even though it was 1pm..lol.  When we ordered our dishes, I noticed the waiter didn't write anything down.  I was impressed by this, but I also hoped that he didn't forget anything. =)    While we waited for our appetizer, another waiter brought out a bread basket.  There were 2 bread sticks and half a loaf of sourdough bread.  The bread stick was crunchy.  I wonder if Scoma's made the bread stick.  The sourdough bread was very fresh!  It reminded me of Boudin's bread in Fisherman's Wharf, too.    There is a bottle of olive oil on the table, so my boyfriend and his friend poured it onto the bread plate.  They mentioned the bread stick didn't taste good with olive oil.  Appetizer: Cup of Clam Chowder All of us ordered the clam chowder as our appetizer, and we all loved it!  The clam chowder was filled with so many ingredients.  I remember tasting clams and crab!  The chowder was not too creamy, but it was very flavorful.  I think its the best chowder ever!  Entree: Broiled Swordfish with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies I was surprised by the huge piece of swordfish on my plate.  The swordfish was very juicy, so it was cooked perfectly.  The mashed potatoes was very good and not garlicy at all.  The steamed veggies was good, too.  Dessert: chocolate cheesecake with raspberry sauce and whip cream The chocolate cheesecake was very delicious.  The raspberry sauce went well with the cheesecake.  Even though the decor is fancy, the dress code is just casual. =)  The service here is great, too.  When ever we had an empty plate on the table, the waiter would remove it immediately.

deSAoTng9ytmUDx_q9bl2A.review_text: doesn't get any better then here. Fresh seafood. Excellent crabs in crab season. Reasonably priced as well.

9VUBm41ZyGrLo4seD7Iqgg.review_text: Pretty good seafood although the portions are way too big and the way they stack the side dishes that come with each meal, the plating is less than elegant. My son's shrimp and scallop dish came with both rice and potatoes -- carb overload!!  Fun atmosphere although very touristy and noisy.  Waiter didn't warn me when I ordered three extra sides for the table, even though sides come with most dishes already.  Better choices in SF although at uber-touristy Fisherman's Wharf, Scoma's is probably as good as is gets.

2t2HCw37rOKKWnT8C_yDng.review_text: I've always heard of Scomas, but never ate there. However, for my birthday this year, I was treated to a nice dinner at Scomas.  Located at Fisherman's Wharf, this landmark restaurant is great for seafood. It was a bit difficult to find as you couldn't even google it. Fortunately, I know the City well enough that it didn't take long to find. It's hidden inside an alley way. The waiters were all old school as well.   If you love cioppino, I suggest you order it at Scomas. It was yummy! The portion of so huge that you could share it with four people. A bit on the pricey side I have to say...I ordered the lazy man cioppino and it was $35, but it was worth it. The tiramisu was yummy too.  My only complaint is they don't take reservations.

FvoFPjosY2TG6KGuw5mxuQ.review_text: This restaurant was a little hidden. It was on a boat restaurant hidden down a dark alley way behind buildings. Don't be fooled though, the inside of the boat was very nice and intimate. It was a very cute place to have a date and that's what we did!  My boyfriend and I started off with the Mediterranean Mussels and it was amazing. One of the best mussels my boyfriend and I have ever had. It was lightly sauteed and steamed in a buttery wine sauce and it was simply amazing.  I had the Shellfish Saute and it was lightly seasoned so you could really taste the seafood itself. This dish comes with a generous amount of scallops, shrimps and I believe there was lobster in there. I had a side of veggies and pasta. I wished the pasta was seasoned or had some sauce with it to make the dish more flavorful. Overall, this dish wasn't heavily seasoned and so it was simple and plain. But the seafood was so fresh and so good that it made up for the lack of seasoning.  Overall, we will probably come back for the mussels and to try their other seafood selections.

KovBn7Ltu8olrKJ0cU0xnA.review_text: Had an amazing time! Food was perfect! Everything was fresh, service was wonderful! We had an appetizer trio with calamari/crab cakes/rock shrimp, it was like butta! Melted in your mouth! For dinner we had chioppino and crab ravioli's, it was delicious! I will definitely be coming back. We did have to wait an hour to be seated but they have a full bar with lounge area (and a nice view), time went by quickly. Very much worth the wait.

px2AZNJaNKOoh8mj5q39Tw.review_text: Excellent food and service here. And free valet parking--almost unheard of in SF! Prices on the high side, though. And this is not (despite what you might think) a restaurant with a view (You can see a dilapidated pier and a warehouse.),  But, oh...that seafood!  Our group had calamari, prawn cocktail and lump -meat crab appetizers-all great. I tried the seafood cannelloni, which were superb, served with penne pasta and fresh sauteed veggies. All the other entries were good,, too (mixed shellfish saute, calamari, crab cakes and crab risotto). No room for dessert after that, though.  I really had expected to have views of the GG Bridge, but other than that and the rather high price tag, the place met or exceeded my expectations for a great lunch with out of town visitors.

gAb2Ckhh7ktO0w_vBHygXA.review_text: Why would you go to San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf and NOT have seafood?! When a restaurant has its own Fish Receiving Station right next to the restaurant, you KNOW that the seafood would be the freshest if could ever be.  My parents came here on a Sunday for lunch and at noon, there were barely any free tables available. Make sure you get there early or make a reservation! By the time we left the restaurant around 1pm, there were so many people waiting for tables.  The three of us shared a Mixed Shellfish Platter for 2 which had clams, oysters and meaty chunks of crab. The freshness of the seafood was amazing and it was a great starter to our meal. For mains, I had the Crab Louis - their most popular lunch item. It was a massive mound of salad with a gigantic serving of crab. I love crab but this was just too much. It would be great to share it with somebody. My parents had the Scallop Saute and the Swordfish Piccata. The swordfish was pretty decent but the scallops were not so great.   I would love to come back here again to try some of the other items on the menu. And I would definitely want to go at an earlier time so that I could snag one of the fancy tables near the windows. Seafood and a view of the ocean - how fancy.

p5_Y8pWimTDheF-YmLLEQQ.review_text: Top quality service, strong drinks, best clam chowder of my vacation here in San Francisco. Had the salmon over lobster ravioli with lobster tail and loved it. The sauce was excellent.

qu5jGZlh4n1r2-Fempkvvw.review_text: Yo! This place is pretty fuckin fancy! Only place where I can get swordfish that isn't overcooked, totally worth it bro!

l2hZ2026wemwnT4a60b2Xw.review_text: We reluctantly dined here last week after visiting friends insisted on meeting here. What a disaster. First was a wait of 45 min on a Tuesday night - don't come here if you have a large party or small children! I ordered Ahi which was barely seared - cold in the middle - and the soy sauce had about 5x as much sodium - the wasabi looked and tasted as if it had been sitting for a few days. Mrs. B had the sauted shrimp which was okay but not worthy of the $30 price tag. I also had the clam chowder which was okay but nothing special.  The service was fine but the food was grossly overpriced - about double what you would pay at the wonderful Pacific Cafe, for less appetizing food. Kuleto's up the street is also cheaper and has amazing views of the GG Bridge. Even Alioto's #8 is better.  Anybody who dines here might as well be burning money. But the real tragedy is that you would pay so much for such bad seafood when there are so many better options in the city.

cdJ5S-kFqXRt1P4NaIyCIQ.review_text: Followed on of the reviews and ordered the Lazy Man's Cioppino. It was absolutey delicious! Our waiter Waiman made the dinner even better due to superb service'

jCeKLgAVZGIiGHhLHvLGKg.review_text: Maybe it's cuz we had just biked for the last 5 hours from SF over the bridge and into Sausalito on a beautiful clear sunny date and we were just fatigued and starving ... not really sure... but regardless, I have to say we had some amazing seafood pasta dishes here!  We had a linguine with light white cream sauce and shrimp, clams, etc. which was cooked perfectly... pasta was al dente, seafood tasted really fresh, cream sauce was packed with flavor and not too heavy.  Sad to admit this but at the end of the meal when the server was coming to take our plates I looked at her like she was crazy... i wasn't letting that plate go til every last drop of sauce was sopped up by their sourdough bread... which btw, was pretty awesome on it's own (as I guess most sourdough in SF is).  I mean, by the time I was done with my plate, it looked like it was already washed, dried n ready for serving again...  Ravioli was so-so, nothing special... calamari was great!  Another pasta dish with dungeness crab (can't remember if it was a special or on the reg menu) was just as amazing as the pasta dish above...   The restaurant has an outdoor deck which sits right on the water... inside looks a bit old-school... clean but if you ever make it out here on a decent day, def sit outside... beautiful spot.

R_QmwBJhwI5K0o6WZRTttg.review_text: Resturaunt is located next to the water. Beautiful views near the pier. They do vallet parking so parking is not an issue! Make a reservation or you'll be waiting for at least 45 mins. Service was great staff and waiters are friendly. Ordered the 12 oz steak medium well. Steak was prepared on point to how I like it. Was nice and tender juicy. Gf ordered the pasta diplomatica was very tasty in creamy sauce mixed in with scallops, clams, shrimp and lobster. Serving size was filling! Most items on the menu are pricey but I do plan on coming back. I guess you pay for what you get and the quality of the food is great!

qUUMmANmVRuQxagzH8irhA.review_text: Yes, the seafood was delicious. The scallops were just AMAZING!   Dinner deal: one appetizer, one entree, one desert = $39.95. (order the lobster bisque and scallops!!!)  This was a pretty good deal compared to everything else that was $30+ for one dish. The dishes were pretty good portions though. For a family of 5, we got 1 dinner deal and 2 side entrees and took a small box home for leftovers.   Free valet parking. Calming view next to the bay.   30 min+ wait. But you can drink at the bar while waiting.  OVERALL: delicious seafood but a little on the pricey end. It's still worth it :)

XFhKCchgNDRxj43dAp4RIw.review_text: Excellent ,service and food . Took Uber from downtown and it was a great experience . I only choose this place based on the Yelp reviews . And once again you fellow yelpers did not let me down .

P7oKHASn4S_IkBiQaS02ng.review_text: We made a reservation and were seated almost right away.  It is tight quarters inside, but we did not feel like we were eating with the people next to us.  The wait staff was good, but not incredibly fast or responsive.  The food however, is excellent!  Everyone (all 9 of us) enjoyed our meal and although pricey (at least $100 a couple), it was a nice treat!

7sxLWrECG44ZMnmbLSGYMw.review_text: I was recently there a few days before Thanksgiving with some visitors from out of the country.  I was quite disappointed, I had the Lazy Man's Cioppino and the clam chowder.  The chowder was not good... The Cioppino was watery and bland.   For the price, better to go to The Waterbar down the street...

2d3W8FgX62KXSbz3Miiz0g.review_text: I really don't know why Scoma is getting reviews that are less than 5 stars. It's probably the dumb tourists.   The food is great, the service is fantastic, and I can't think of anything wrong with the restaurant. I've been going here for years and the only thing that's changed is the patrons' dress code. Yes, I wish I saw less khaki shorts and striped polos, but times, they have'a changed.   Five stars, Scoma. Good work.

d3LbTQph31jHW4vwCcDZnw.review_text: I went to Scoma's for lunch this past Saturday and had the best crab ravioli and my friend had the crab cake dinner. Even though the décor is dated I like it for that reason.   The server was great. It was my first time there and I plan to go back for special occasions. This is the place to go if you want to eat a seafood meal without the pretence.

lyCpHiFR5-JfUFGVupGfMg.review_text: Fresh seafood in the simplest of preparation = excellence! I believe that if it is fresh seafood, forget the sauces, grill it. They do fish well. If you are here in March, make sure you order the fresh halibut (today started the season)! Fantastic.   The wait staff never rushed us nor over sold the dishes. Felt like Europe!   Worth the wait for a seaside window, if you are two. (A few flying deuces)   Only critiques, limited wine menu and cramped seating.

jlKAjPI3hQiAtkXLoq-KZA.review_text: A staple at the wharf. Sat at the bar as there was a wait for a table at lunch. Definitely wise to book a reservation! Enjoyed the beautiful view, the libations and good company at the bar. Had the lobster bisque, oysters rockafeller and the Sea Bass. Everything was amazingly flavorful and fresh. I will be back again to try new things! They have a great prix fixe lunch menu definitely worth checking out. I will definitely be back to enjoy the scenery at night!

6eS1LvgPp_1xa6mhoI7HIw.review_text: Should be called "Lazy Man's Cioppino" rather than Scoma's cuz quite frankly, it's just that damn good... Prawns, Shrimp, Clams, Sea Scallops, Fresh Fish & Dungeness Crab all stewed together in a huge bowl of deliciousness... You could also opt for the Cioppino alla Pescatore which is exactly the same thing but you'll have to get your hands dirty cracking the crab open yourself.   This is by far the best Cioppino I have ever devoured. Nothing on the Wharf, both in SF, Monterey Bay or San Diego have even come close. All others fail in comparison... You get the picture... Oh, if you happen to swing by when they are offering Salmon as the catch of the day, OMG... It's luscious. Melts in your mouth. To quote Stewie Griffin, "This Salmon is delightful...oh, this is like an orgy in my mouth!" Enjoy!

WM4DXNTq4vb81rEFXsH_9A.review_text: Love This Place......  Can you say, "MARKET PRICE"?   ALL of the food is Fan-Tas-Tic!! Service is Spectacular, especially if you have "Papi".  Old World Charm, Excellent Service, Very Good Food... Make a reservation or expect to wait, but its worth the wait!

2NE342yPvoeeN0S2JIZRKg.review_text: Going to this place is a tradition in my family every time we visit San Francisco, and it's not difficult to understand why. The food is amazing and so is the service. The location isn't great and the view isn't exciting, but the atmosphere is pretty neat in this place.

8k4Dr7-XVS3ywpYsksf_MA.review_text: Parental tour 2013 was in its infancy, and their first full day on the west coast was spent in lovely San Francisco. We'd already tripped down to Alamo Square so my mom could get pictures of the Painted Ladies, and up to Lombard to check out switchback alley (I mean the Crooked Street!) so the only thing to do from there was walk/run/jog down Hyde and head for lunch at Scoma's!   Ok, I've never been here, but the reviews are really great, and who doesn't love a little old school charm right along the waterfront? I knew we had to be in for something pretty great when I saw how many open seats a lot of the restaurants we passed had, and then how few there were at Scoma's. Maybe it's just good marketing?   The building is pretty unassuming, the interior however is all dark wood, low ceilings, and tablecloths. White shirted black pantsed men hover EVERYWHERE. We were seated quickly and brought menus. Drinks were ordered and bread was munched upon. Now, the ever important task of deciding what to eat!  Well...I had to try the cioppino...despite its' steep price tag. Seriously...40 bucks for soup? It's soup. Again, trusting to my reviewing counterparts, I just didn't see how I could turn it down. My mom was apparently feeling the soup vibes as well, so we both ordered it. My dad got a scallop/shrimp dish, and the boy got salmon fettuccine.   Oh. Holy. Crap. This soup was...ok, first off there's a ton of it. It should come with some kind of warning like Caution - Bowl Will Be Size of Your Head. I don't think I could have eaten this whole bowl if I'd starved myself for three days. As it was I barely got through half. My mom was the same way - if only we'd known, we could have split it! Dad loved his food - he felt they were a little chintzy with the scallops, but he really enjoyed the shrimp. The boy was just kinda meh on his salmon. I tasted a bite and I could tell why. Seasonings were a bit off, and, well...he's from Alaska, and has pretty high standards for smoked salmon.   The service was really on par. Our waiter was helpful and very chatty. I just wish he'd given us some indication about the enormity of soup that was coming our way.  I mean, by all means, get it. There's a ton of fish and crab and scallops and shrimp and everything under the sea. It's seasoned excellently. There's just so. so. much.  I felt bad cause we couldn't really take it with us, given all the sightseeing still left to do, but...yeah.  The place is legit, the food is stellar and plentiful, and the servers are excellent. Totally go here. Bring your family.

w80W64gsR3uvkeWKzIDefw.review_text: I would give this 4.5 stars in fact, because some of the extremely good seafood places in city of SF.  Unfortunately they dont let me give it 1/2 of a point :).   came here on a Wed. night, to find it pretty full and bustling.  It was nice to be at a place with an international crowd - heard Italian, Japanese and a Slavic language which I could not figure out.    If you go here, try to find parking at the back - just drive straight down there and let the Restaurant take care of the parking ;).    On to the food, one of the best Tuna Steaks' I have had.  I had a local fresh fish, dont remember the name but starts with a P - and it was good - sort of like a Halibut but softer.  My friend got the lobster, which was delicious as well.  Also got an sampler - and tried the crab cakes - good / calamari - tasted goooood, but texture wasnt the best.  Overall I would definitely rate it high.  Good place to take a date to as well.  Avg about 40$ w/o drinks, so it is moderately expensive place to eat.

pOsSRzm0ZOXE9FcJ5pWxYg.review_text: My friend thinks that you can tell a lot about a date from the car that he drives.  Too bad I never notice what people drive.  Friend:  "What kind of car does he drive?" Me:  "Um black?"  I think you can tell a lot by the restaurant he chooses.  Examples:  Universal Cafe  (Solid choice, promising.) Andalu  (OK, but no sparks.) Benihana  (This relationship is DOOMED.)***  I wasn't sure about Scoma's though.   Here is the play by play with points allotted accordingly:  Almost mowing down a slew of Fisherman's Wharf tourists:  -20 points or +20 points (depending on how you feel about tourists)  Painless and affable valet parking:  +10  They don't take reservations:  -50  Since it's Saturday that will be at least a half hour wait:  -10  But you can sit at the nice bar area and sip on Prosecco:  +20  But there is a chode there complaining, "WHADDYA MEAN YOU DON'T HAVE ANY RED BULL?!?!:  -100  Classy, friendly bartender Henry who mollified Mr. Chode with a jack and coke:  +15   Nice view of the Bay:  +20  It was foggy:  -10  We finally got a table:  +30  Next to a huge group of Japanese tourists:  -10  Cordial and spot on service:  +20  Brusque and highly efficient food runner (aka the Eastern European auntie I never had):  +20  Slightly soggy and greasy Calamari Fritti:  +10  One of the best pasta dishes I've ever had:  Scoma's perfectly cooked huge Broiled Prawns on al dente Linguine Pomodoro (tossed simply with very fresh Tomato, Garlic, and Basil):  +125  Scoma's Justifiably Infamous Lazy Man's Cioppono with Prawns, Shrimp, Clams, Sea Scallops, Fresh Fish, and a 1/2 Shelled Dungeness Crab in a Soul Soothing, Rich Tomato Broth:  +200  Extra slices of Cioppono enhancing Garlic Toast:  +10  Large portion sizes leaving zero room for luscious looking desserts:  -10                          Total Points = Great Spot for a Yummy Seafood Dinner with Romance-Inhibiting-but-Maximum-People-Watching Tourists!    *** This was in response to me saying that I like Japanese food.  Japanese Food FAIL.

c8bbMULLyAVEYlYjuw4XJA.review_text: Some of the best sea food in the city. I have been coming here for 30 years and this place never lets me down.

JOKzFTvuZQ2EBgdXkY6Lfw.review_text: I'm a vegetarian so I wasn't expecting to enjoy my meal as much as my seafood-loving friend but I was most definitely surprised. The garden salad, pasta pomodoro & bread pudding were wonderful and the garlic bread is the best ever! Cocktails are great here also...will definitely be back.

8pDgDxzBdQKbTaNX6mxJGw.review_text: Eating at Scoma's single-handedly transformed me from hating seafood to loving it.   As a recovering picky eater, ocean critters were in the last bastion of foodstuffs I was unwilling to appreciate. Cue family dinner in the city, no other options, and a seafood medley of some sort, and here I am happily chomping away on cocktail shrimp.   Downsides in retrospect are that it was quite expensive, but the place is well located, well-staffed, and quintessential San Francisco/Fisherman's Wharf. It's probably worth trying at least once, especially for the out-of-towners.

Ev30yBOhUxRKc2NhKk6jag.review_text: I took my boyfriend to scomas for his birthday and it was a great experience. The food was delicious!!! we ordered a shrimp cocktail and a seafood pasta, and all the seafood here was fresh. the restaurant was super busy and really every table was taken however we were still able to enjoy the nice view of fishermans wharf from the big windows. At the end of our meal my bday boy got a strawberry cheesecake which was also really yummy.   A bit pricey but well worth it. Next time we visit San Francisco again we will definetly be making a stop at scomas :)

aYEqNwqF-YsB9g7lmrAJvQ.review_text: This has been like #1 on my list of TO TRY restaurants, since I'm such a big fan of seafood. And sadly, I would have to say that I have been somewhat disappointed. I had called in a while back to inquire about a possible reservation for a larger party (since they don't normally take reservations with the exception of larger parties). I was told that it was something called preferred seating, where my group could be sat half an hour after our arrival. I was told to call back to confirm the number of people the day of, which I did. I had spoken with Nick (the man to go to), and he had been quite pleasant both times. He said that it wasn't a problem. My original suggestion was that I wanted to make it for 8:00, but since he had told me we'd be sat about half an hour after, I told him 7:30 instead and he said that was great. But sadly, even though we started arriving at 7:10, with basically only one person to wait on by 7:45 and all arrived before 8:00, we did not get sat until almost 8:45. Yes, I understand that restaurants do have their problems with turn-over times, guests arriving late and all that crap, but it was too long compared to what I bargained for. And as much as I'd like to like Nick, he did not speak with me even once throughout the wait or our entire session there (although he knew I was there and all of us impatiently waiting). But that is fine, he is not who I want to complain about. MY ENTIRE PARTY of 14 had something to say about the hostess. I mean, she sounded RUDE on the phone, but she was even WORST to deal with in person! She does not qualify to be an hostess!! Everytime I approached her, she either didn't bother to look over for the longest time, didn't bother to let me know when we were going to be seated or gave us the "soon" answer which was of course an hour and a half later. I was not the only one that could read the rude and incompetent expression on her face. Yes, everybody (without me commenting) said that she was a total bitch. I cannot believe that a decent restaurant like this would have a hostess like that!  Now after all the complaints, lets go to judging the food and what I do like. One member didn't like the clam chowder, while the other really did. I heard that the squash soup was good, and my lobster bisque was just alright. I'm guessing.. its fine to stay away from the soups. I heard no other complaints throughout the whole night, so I'm guessing what they ordered were good. I had some of the crab cake dinner, and it was good but not too memorable. I did remember the chunks of crab though, so thats a good sign. There were also wonderful compliments on the lobster thermidor I ordered, but I actually liked the one over at Crab House better. The lobster ravioli got major approval from my friend and myself, so I would have to say that's the dish I'd definitely order again.  I ordered the tiramisu and it looked absolutely wonderful, with an edible chocolate spoon even (which I gave away). It tasted good, but I'm not sure if its real, traditional tiramisu. Because our server later found out that it was my birthday, he also came out with a chocolate marquise, which was very good indeed.  At first there were some looks around the table because our server had such an heavy accent (French perhaps), it was a bit difficult to understand. But I thought that he was absolutely wonderful and I think he grew on everybody as dinner went on through the night. He was so nice and he kept checking in with us and asking us if we had any questions.  There was a view I believe in the room we had, but it was pretty dark and I didn't pay much attention. This restaurant has potential, but I'm really not feeling the no reservation policy. On top of that, our semi-reservation turned into a mess. I would've given this place a 3.5 star, but the hostess totally takes a whole star away if not more. I did like our server though, so I'll just leave it at a 3. And plus, they do have free valet parking.  I'd probably come back here.. but they seriously need to fire Miss Hostess over there.  P.S. some of their other bussers/waiters/waitresses were quite nice as well. They weren't impatient with us at all (when we were basically the last ones left in the restaurant).

RpdICavpFWuPD_LxPriQoQ.review_text: Great food and atmosphere, was worth the wait. The meals are large enough for two to share which makes the prices reasonable.

N3MXkPX7niDRbdiZavNmuQ.review_text: Lunch @ Scoma's...  Excellent service.  Great food.  Nice location.  Of all the places I've dined at on the Wharf, I'd say this was the best.  Not a huge fan of clam chowders in general, but their's was delish!  They only serve wild caught fish which, in my opinion, is the way to go if you're going to enjoy fish.  Will definitely be back~

t2zNTDTEhlKB4JsYJFMZJQ.review_text: Not worth the money.  My wife and I went here for a special dinner for our honeymoon.  I was very disappointed.  I had made a reservation through open table, and we arrived less than 5 minutes early.  We had to wait another 10 minutes for our table.  I had told them it was a special night and they said 'we have a blue top table for you right on the water'. Well we ended up at a table for two, with tables on either side of us less than 1 foot away.  The restaurant was crowded, cold and loud, and we could hear all the sounds coming out of the kitchen.  The seafood was not cleaned properly (sand still in lobster and clams), the rice was undercooked, and the crab cakes tasted like glorified tuna salad.  There was no recognition of our special occasion.  We will not be coming back.

-AHLWpH_Ii_mJ95QLe3lwg.review_text: Scomas as always been one of my favorites until this past weekend. I ordered the Fisher Mans Pasta. Thinking it had a variety of seafood but I guess this Fisher Man sucked all it had was baby bay shrimp and very small amount of crab meat. I got all that for $38.00. Scomas fisher men need to turn it up a notch. I would have been okay if I paid $12.00 to $15.00 but $38 for some pasta with bay shrimp and the crab so small I couldn't taste it not worth the price $$$$$ sorry Scomas I do not think I will go back so many other great places in the city. I called and you said it has been on the menu for 40 years at the price now I'm really done :-)

jIllv_or24bQ97niC0OWDw.review_text: On a rainy day, my friend and I impulsively decided to go to Fisherman's Wharf. I yelped where to eat and this place had really good reviews, so I persuaded my friend who wanted to get street food, and we sat down. And.. after the meal, I felt so bad for dragging her along. We got calamari frutti dinner, pasta alla scoma, and "lazy man's" cioppino. Two girls ordering three main dishes must have confused the waiter. She was like, "You girls are ordering too much..?" Ha Ha.   The calamari was really good, it came with rice, penn pasta (why..?), and steamed veggies. We both liked it. Pasta alla scoma was not so great. Pasta was overcooked and I thought my teeth would break from all the lil rocks/sand from my clams .. However, The biggest disappoint of this experience was the cioppino. After seeing a lot of reviewers raving about how excellent this was, I decided to get it and ugh what a waste it turned out to be. It's way salty. Basically, it's a "lazy" dish with bunch of seafoods thrown in a marinara sauce. SALTY. I literally drank 4 cups of water just to eat the swimming seafoods.   Although the food we got sucked.. Atmosphere is great here. All the waiters seem really veteran and know what they are doing. I think we just chose bad food perhaps.. Maybe I will try Scoma's again..

0l_0KpelMBhHzflxt8PkqA.review_text: Old.  School.  They let the fish do the talking here.  Crabcakes so full of crab that they seem held together by sheer will.  A halibut filet that was cooked to perfection and barely seasoned--it's nice to know what halibut actually tastes like.  An enormous lobster tail for mother that will probably be memorialized in a quilt.  All of these plates served with sides of veggies and penne, again barely seasoned so as to bring us all down back to earth.
